story:
Short Summary

My name is Dylan Michael Rowen. I am 13 years old and about to celebrate my Bar-Mitzvah. To mark this rite of passage, I am  giving back to my community with a "Mitzvah Project" to raise money for a cause that I believe in.

I have a deep passion for music, and the power that music has. I truly believe that music can make a difference in peoples lives. I recently learned that music is tool used to help aging adults who are suffering from Alzheimer's disease. 

"When used appropriately, music can shift mood, manage stress-induced agitation, stimulate positive interactions, facilitate cognitive function, and coordinate motor movements."

I believe that I can make a difference by providing music for these individuals who otherwise would not have access to this type of therapy.(Information from Alzheimer's Foundation of America Website www.alzfdn.org)

What We Need

I am raising $290.00 in addition to the $560 already raised to purchase ipods and headphones for Alzheimer's patients in my community. All proceeds will go to the Jewish and Family Career Services Aviv Older Adult Services for Alzheimers patients.

The Impact


The impact of my Mitzvah Project will help allow aging Alzheimers patients who do not have resources otherwise, to utilize music as a meaningful therapy.This music will make them feel better, increase their cognitive function, and help stimulate their mind.

Music can make a meaningful difference in peoples live.


Other Ways You Can Help

To learn more about Music Therapy for Alzheimers patients please visit:
http://www.alzfdn.org/EducationandCare/musictherapy.html

To learn more about Jewish Family and Career Services Aviv Older Adult Programs visit:
https://yourtoolsforliving.org/services/older-adults

story:
WHO WE ARE--

In the photo above is the Bear Creek High School Girls Golf Team, in Lodi Unified School District, in Stockton. They work hard in their school work.  The girls golf team has one of the highest GPA’s of any sports team at Bear Creek. The girls’ interests include golf, soccer, track, drama, art, writing, literature and swimming. In the future, they see themselves working in careers such as medicine, engineering, education, business and journalism.  In the fall, these girls focus on golf and work hard to become better golfers.  A few girls have played for years and others are picking up clubs for the first time when they join the high school team.  This off-season the girls are planning to keep playing with each other and with programs such as First Tee.

WHAT WE NEED--

With budget cuts, money to support any extra curricular activity is limited.  The girls on the team provide their own uniforms and equipment, including clubs, balls, tees and shoes. The school provides the money for green fees for the matches and a small stipend that the coaches share. The school also provides golf bags, very old golf bags. The bags the girls use are at least 15 years old. They are also used by the boys golf team. 

The bags are why the team is reaching out to you. The bags have been used beyond their life span. The team needs new golf bags. Bags have been priced and for less than $1,200, 10 high quality golf bags could be purchased. This amount could not be raised by the girls on their own. Please make a donation to the team so that new bags can be purchased.

KEEPS THE PLAYERS IN THE GAME--on the course and in life

Skills and qualities the players learn while golfing include honesty, respect, cooperation, perseverance, problem-solving and integrity. Those skills will carry through to all the things the girls do in life.  Thank you so much for considering lending your support to the team. Your donation would help the team make a purchase that will last for many years. 

If you can't contribute, we ask that you share our story with people you know-- friends, co-workers, golfers and on facebook and Twitter.

story:
Our Team

Our team of 10 girls and 2 boys compete like little piranhas in the 2nd grade Co-ed division youth basketball. We aren't the biggest, fastest, or most athletic team and we certainly aren't the richest, but we're tough, committed, and last season we didn't lose one game (though we tied a couple).

So far we've been able to get by on a small court and a few basketballs. However, we could use some new equipment and some money to rent proper gym space with proper court spacing.

What We Need 

We need money to 

  • buy basketballs for everyone and have a few extra for specific drills and cones to take home and practice what we learn in camp (for kids already with a ball, it's nice to have a back up) (Approx $100-$120)
  • to rent court space ($150)
  • Fees for Indie Go Go ($24-$40 depending on whether or not we reach our goal)
  • to rent a projector ($10)
  • to buy supplementary equipment (plastic water bottles for re-use throughout the season (http://www.walmart.com/ip/Cramer-Collapsible-Water-Bottle-Carrier/4029406), Gatorade for rewards, fruit to snack on) (approx $80-$100)
  • and of course to buy camp t-shirts for everybody (hopefully featuring Uncle Grandpa dressed up like a Rebel Warrior) ($150-$200).

We also need money to purchase some Rebel Warrior swag (like stickers, temporary tattoos, car decals, and t-shirts) to give out as perks in return for donating to the team.(could vary, depending on contributions and perks claimed. ($50-$100)

Our Program

Coach Luke and Coach Sammy have spent countless fun hours (when we should have been doing many other things, believe me) designing a specialized program for this group of kids we happen to know very well. We have combined our experience with research into age appropriate, yet challenging, exercises, ball handling, shooting, and defensive drills, and basketball concepts. We have put together a fun, engaging, fast paced program meant to challenge our young athletes physically and build on the strengths they have developed over past seasons. 

The Spring Camp will happen during the school's spring break week, Monday March 24-Friday March 28. The first four days will be 3 hours and the last day will be just an hour and half. We will be moving and grooving all day, so expect your kids to come home tired and happy. We have plenty of water breaks scheduled, video breaks, and a fruit snack break we will have each day before the final phase of the day, the scrimmage and games section.

On the last day we will hand out camp t-shirts, play a few games and have a surprise (not telling what it is but you won't want to miss it!!)


The Impact

Two major impacts: First, our team has worked very hard over the last three seasons to build on their fundamental skills and they have improved greatly. Yet, we are at that point where we need more to get us to the next level. Help us get to the next level!!

Second...those of you familiar with our team know that last year we surprised and upset many who may have pre-judged our team based on our gender make up. This season we don't have the element of surprise. We need to get off to a fast start and a solid, fun, productive spring break camp would be the perfect start! 

Finally...thirdly, and I know I said two, but there is one more biggie...if our team finds success working hard together then there is a chance that some of these children could form positive associations with sports and teamwork, setting them up for a healthier, happier, and more successful life. They could get exercise, have fun, build and strengthen friendships, develop into well rounded athletes and build a positive self image and all of that, so there is that too. 

Other Ways You Can Help

When you make your relatives buy fundraisers for school you have to know that only a small portion of that money goes back to your kid's school and only a fraction of that reaches your child. But here, only a tiny fraction goes to fees (pay pal & Indie go go) and then the team gets to keep most of the money. Invest in your child, niece, nephew, or grand-kid directly! Please make a donation. Any little bit helps.

And tell your relatives and friends. Share! Get the word out! Invite people to like the Rebel Warriors facebook page!

story:
We Miss You!

And that is 100% the main reason we moved into a bigger apartment. Seriously. There's no guest room in our lives, but there is a big, sunny living room that is just begging for a sleeper sofa!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $1000 to buy a sleeper sofa that is new, comfortable, and not hideous. Here's your chance to own a piece of it. Whatever you can contribute is your down payment on a vacation to NYC! We'll be paying for the thing no matter what, so throw down $50 or $5 and start a flight alert today.

Other Ways You Can Help

Got a Visa or Ikea gift card laying around in the bottom of your purse? We'll take it!

story:
7 Healthcare Professionals. 1 Week.

$50,000 Worth of Medication. 

800 Children.  

Our team of doctors, dentists and nurses travels to Honduras on an annual basis for a week in March. Our mission is to bring healthcare to children who live in remote communities in Honduras. These children come from families who are too poor to afford dental or medical care. Our goal is to provide support to these peripheral villages by providing free medical and dental care. We will also be brining over $50,000 worth of medications and supplies to leave in these communities. Over the course of the week we will provide care to over 800 children. 

The entire team is volunteering week of their time to provide free medical and dental care for children who live in remote and impoverished communites in Honduras. Each of us are paying for own own expenses i.e. flight, accommodation, food, travel etc. 

Honduras is one of the poorest countries in the world and 60% of its population falls below the World Bank’s national poverty line. Also, it is estimated that 280,000 children between the ages of 5-14 are forced to work in order to earn enough money for their families to eat.

We will be based in Gracias, Honduras but will be travelling, on average, about six hours a day to the surrounding rural villages.

What We Need & Why

The entire team is volunteering week of their time to provide free medical and dental care for children who live in remote and impoverished communites in Honduras. Each of us are paying for own own expenses i.e. flight, accommodation, food, travel etc. 

But we need your help to cover the cost of medications and supplies that we are leaving in Honduras!! We can't do it without your help! Every dollar goes a long way in Honduras!

  • Each container has $5000 worth of medication in it.
  • There are 10 containers = $50,000 of medications
  • Each container is subsidised by the pharmaceutical company so only costs $500 
  • One container ($500) provides enough medication to supply an entire village in Honduras

Our team from last year's mission trip with the locals who hosted us.

The Impact

We want to make sure you get something back for your generosity. Every single dollar counts, so we want to show our appreciation for your support.

First of all, there will be a blog with written posts and photos so that you can follow along with us on our mission trip. If you decide to support our mission and donate money, we also have some added perks for you. The possibilities include:

  • A postcard from Honduras
  • A picture of our team in the village which we will send to you along with a personalized thank you note.
  • A video thank you message from our team while we are on the road in Honduras
  • A photo book of our journey in Honduras

                   

             Some of the little girls from last years mission waiting to be seen.

Other Ways You Can Help

We completely understand if you aren't able to donate. Thank you for taking the time to visit our project page. There are definitely lots of other ways you can help us though!

  • Help us spread the word - Share our link on any and all of your social media pages
  • Help us network - Send us names/contacts of people you know who would be interested in donating
  • Keep us in your thoughts/prayers - This is probably the most important part of our entire project so please keep the prayers and thoughts coming!

From our entire team - THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

Driving through Honduras.

story:
The Cause:

This morning I was given a $2 bill along with a challenge - to deploy that $2 in the most impactful and far reaching way.  From that challenge TWODOLLARCAUSES was born.

The Need:

The nation of the Philippines has experienced a natural disaster of unimaginable size and scope.  The nation is in dire need of aid and support.

The Amount:

The amount that I ask you donate is $2.  (Of course we will accept more if you would like to donate more)

The Funds Distribution Channel:

100% of the funds raised (Less Indiegogo Fees) will go towards the Philippines Typhoon Disaster Relief.  The Charity that will be distributing the fund is Samaritans Purse.

The Goal:

The goal is to raise $500 in 7 days.

story:
You Missed The Campaign!!

Pre-Order at RebelSpeakers.com


Rebel Speaker was Featured as 

Indiegogo's Campaign of the Day on November 2, 2013!!


PERKS GUARANTEED TO SHIP!

Our funding goal was met in the first 24 hours of our campaign which means you are now guaranteed to receive your perks when you contribute to our campaign!


Stretch Goals Added!


Rebel is Tiny, Powerful, Wireless and Not Afraid of the Shower!

We all know the dilemma, you want to listen to your playlist in the shower but if you lose another smartphone to water damage you'll flip out, so you buy a "waterproof" case which then makes your music sound terrible...the solution? 

Meet Rebel.

Rebel is a tiny yet powerful Bluetooth speaker that connects wirelessly with your smartphone, tablet, MP3 player, computer and more!

You can play music, skip tracks, adjust the volume and even answer phone calls from anywhere without touching your phone.

Use Rebel as a smartphone stand or stick it to walls, tables and more. 

Rebel’s built-in suction cup lets you stick it to almost anything:

  • Walls & Tables
  • Refrigerators
  • Phones
  • Car Dashes
  • Showers and more!

The possibilities are endless, where will your Rebel go?


What We Need

We need $1,000 for final tooling and packaging for retail distribution.

  • The speaker is developed, tested and ready to be sold we just need packaging!

Here is the retail packaging we have designed:

What You Get

You get to be a part of the solution, you get to be one of the first to own the Rebel Speaker and you get it all for 50% off the MSRP!

  • Perks will ship within one week of campaign ending successfully.
  • We have created and launched several unique products via CrowdFunding and Social Media, you can trust Morrison Innovations to deliver.
  • Get one for yourself, your sister, your brother, your parents, that guy down the street because you won't see the prices this low again!

Other Ways You Can Help

We have learned that Crowd Funding is a social strategy, we need every backer that believes in us and our products to share them on their social networks and with their friends and family in order for us to be successful...what's the best way to do that? 

Offer Rewards.

We want you to be rewarded for your efforts so this is what we will do for you in addition to sending you perks for your pledge:

  • For every 5 people you refer that pledge $18 or more we will send you an additional Rebel Speaker™ with your perk shipment absolutely FREE!
  • You must be a backer yourself of $18 or more in order to qualify.
  • You will be able to choose your rewards after the campaign ends via BackerKit.

Full Product Description:

Stream music and take calls from the wireless speaker that sticks to anything!

Rebel speakers stick to anything!

  • Compact wireless speaker gives you big sound for music, videos and games
  • Suction cup sticks to almost any surface—even your phone
  • Easy to pair with any Bluetooth-enabled device, like smartphones and tablets
  • Take speakerphone calls with built-in microphone
  • Rechargeable battery for up to 6 hours on a single charge
  • Soft silicone cover with built-in volume controls
  • Super portable—only 2.25 inches tall!

Use it as a smartphone stand or stick it to walls, tables and more. 

Rebel’s built-in suction cup lets you stick it to almost anything:

- Walls & Tables
- Refrigerators
- Phones
- Car Dashes
- Showers and more!

How cool is that? You can even create a convenient smartphone stand so you can watch movies and videos or play games without holding your device. When you want to move it, just pop it off and stick it somewhere else.

Pairs easily with smartphones, tablets, and laptops. 
Upgrade the audio experience for all your music, videos, games and more with Rebel—Bluetooth® speakers that stick to just about anything. Since it’s already in pairing mode when you turn it on, it’s super-easy to connect Rebel™ to your Bluetooth-enabled smartphone, tablet or other music player for big, crystal-clear sound. And once they’re connected, they’ll be friends for life. Then you can stream music, and even adjust volume and tracks right from the speaker.

Take speakerphone calls with Rebel’s built-in microphone.
Rebel™ makes taking hands-free calls easier than ever. With a built-in mic and 33-foot range, you can continue the conversation even when you’re not near your phone (or when you just don’t feel like holding it). Talking for a long time? No problem—Rebel™ has a rechargeable battery that lasts for up to 6 hours on a single charge.

Charges via USB to micro USB cable (cable included)

8 Colors available to suit your style!

Full Product Description:
Stream music and take calls from the wireless speaker that sticks to anything!


Rebel speakers stick to anything!

Compact wireless speaker gives you big sound for music, videos and games
Suction cup sticks to almost any surface—even your phone
Easy to pair with any Bluetooth-enabled device, like smartphones and tablets
Take speakerphone calls with built-in microphone
Rechargeable battery for up to 6 hours on a single charge
Soft silicone cover with built-in volume controls
Super portable—only 2.25 inches tall!




Use it as a smartphone stand or stick it to walls, tables and more. 

Rebel’s built-in suction cup lets you stick it to almost anything:
- Walls & Tables- Refrigerators- Phones- Car Dashes- Showers and more!


How cool is that? You can even create a convenient smartphone stand so you can watch movies and videos or play games without holding your device. When you want to move it, just pop it off and stick it somewhere else.
Pairs easily with smartphones, tablets, and laptops. Upgrade the audio experience for all your music, videos, games and more with Rebel—Bluetooth® speakers that stick to just about anything. Since it’s already in pairing mode when you turn it on, it’s super-easy to connect Rebel™ to your Bluetooth-enabled smartphone, tablet or other music player for big, crystal-clear sound. And once they’re connected, they’ll be friends for life. Then you can stream music, and even adjust volume and tracks right from the speaker.
Take speakerphone calls with Rebel’s built-in microphone.Rebel™ makes taking hands-free calls easier than ever. With a built-in mic and 33-foot range, you can continue the conversation even when you’re not near your phone (or when you just don’t feel like holding it). Talking for a long time? No problem—Rebel™ has a rechargeable battery that lasts for up to 6 hours on a single charge.
Charges via USB to micro USB cable (cable included)


8 Colors available to suit your style!

story:
Hello my name is Cindy and I am a single mom of four children recently diagnosed with lung cancer.

 This past year has been a very hard difficult year for my children and I . It started a year ago when their father, my husband moved us to Florida for a better life, he was offered a job making good money. We left our hometown, our friends, and our home. within three months of being there he up and left us and moved out of state. The children have not seen him since. He was head of the household financially and when he left a lot of devastating things happened to us. We were evicted, stayed in a hotel, stayed in a friends home, we tried renting an apartment but on my salary working full time gone all day and most of the night it didn't make the bills and rent.We didn't know anyone down there and the children were depressed and very angry. I made a decision to move back to NY to be with friends and family, So that my children would feel more secure while I was at work and not at home. They needed to be around people who loved them and would be there for them. We came back four months ago and are staying with an old  friend. in the process we  lost everything we had, including their beds. We could not afford a uhaul to move everything back. The only thing we brought with us was our clothes and keepsakes. Two months into staying with my friend almost a year to the day that their father left I found out I had stage three lung cancer . I was having terrible joint pains, so bad I could not walk, my blood pressure was spiraling out of control, and went to the ER where tests concluded that I had Cancer. I cannot work , and in pain all the time, going through chemo and radiation now and my children are scared, they have lost so much already. I need help to get back on my feet and a place my children can call home. I need to get them beds and make sure they are secure. I want to be able to help my children feel safe again. They are scared and I don't want my Cancer to stop me from doing for them. But I cannot work right now and i need help to raise money to help me get us back on our feet again. Pay off some bills and start fresh. They should not have to pay for what their father did and what I have been diagnosed with. Please find it within your hearts to please help us get back on our feet, It is so hard being a single mom, but so much harder when your sick all the time and fighting for your life.

story:
October 1, 2013

Wow - the outpouring of generosity over the past month has been incredible.  Together, we've raised over $2,000!  

Yesterday, I went by the Tanner House of the YWCA in Central Square and spoke with Clinical Social Worker and Case Manager Schuyler Engel about the community of women she works with and how I can be of service to them.  

Check out the video above to learn more about Tanner House and the women I will be working with next spring!  This is a remarkable place - I feel blessed to have been connected to Schuyler and the women there.  I cannot wait to begin our journey together!

I have just one month left to raise money to go towards tuition, airfare, visas and traveler's insurance, for my adventure to Bali for the 500hr yoga teacher training program, Shakti Initiation ~ every dollar counts!  

Please donate and help me give back to some truly incredible women.  

With gratitude and love,

Mally

*Please feel free to pass this along to anyone you think may be interested in getting involved!*

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

September 1, 2013

HELLO!

My name is Mally Smith ~ I am a Kripalu Yoga teacher and Divine Sleep Yoga Nidra guide living and working in the Boston area and I am going to Bali in February of 2014 to live, eat and breathe yoga at Shakti Initiation, an all-female, 500hr Yoga Teacher Training program.

Check out the video below for more details!


But I can’t go without your help!

This unique training program is lead by two inspiring teachers: Jovinna Chan and Grace Jull.  Together, Jovinna and Grace, will be guiding me, and 24 other female yoga teachers from around the world, on an empowering, transformative journey.  Over the course of the month, we will be diving head first into yogic philosophy, the divine feminine, we will study goddesses from religions and communities all over the world, experience the nourishment and strength of daily yoga practice, and learn tools to integrate all that we learn and channel it into our teaching.

I am currently teaching 12 classes a week, working with a number of private clients and at two different studios in the Boston area.  Participating in Shakti Initiation will not only deepen my personal practice but also greatly enhance what I offer my students, bringing my career as a yoga teacher to the next level.

YOUR DONATION WILL MAKE A DIFFERENCE!

The practice of yoga and meditation is a powerful tool for healing past trauma, and building inner strength.  Unfortunately, classes in this field are not widely accessible and are often avoided, seen as a luxury rather than a necessity.  Upon my return from training, I will donate 100hrs of my time (and hopefully more!) to the YWCA in Central Square, where I will offer free weekly yoga and meditation classes for women who have lived, or are currently living, in domestic abuse environments. 

My hope is that through these classes, I will be able to offer these women healthy and safe tools to manage stress, cultivate self-love, shed the weight of the past and step forward into a life of wholeness and happiness.

WHERE EXACTLY IS THE MONEY GOING?

The tuition for the program is $4,200.  If I reach my goal, the extra $1,000 will go towards the cost of flights, traveler’s health insurance and a temporary visa. 


For more information about me and my yoga practice, visit my website: www.MallySmith.com

story:
Help Those Who Are Differently-abled By A Chromosome 18 Diagnosis

Meet Lane!

Meet our son, Lane!  He is our earth angel.  Lane was diagnosed with 18p deletion syndrome when he was just 18 months old.  He is an amazing little boy.  We learned early that he wasn't going to follow the rules.  He stayed in the hospital for almost a week after he was born, because he wouldn't eat.  At 4 months old, he had his first brain MRI, when the pediatric ophthalmologist noticed he had a partial paralysis of his eye muscles.  He got his first pair of eye glasses the next week (and he still can be stubborn when it comes to wearing them)!  He has also been in rehabilitative therapy since almost 5 months old.  He was late to crawl, late to talk (he was 3 years old), and still lags behind his typically-developing peers on many levels.  But, he is defying the odds, as he is making waves as he grows stronger and smarter every day!  He is a friend to all, always makes sure to share, and has a happy spirit and pure soul that we all envy. 

 

What Is A Chromosome 18 Diagnosis?

If you are like us, our friends, many of the doctors we have met, and even Lane's geneticist, you have never heard of this group of diagnoses.  The prevalence is 1 in 50,000 live births! There are several different Chromosome 18 syndromes that may arise due to unexpected developmental events that occur before birth.  A child may be born with a "duplication" of part of the 18th chromosome;  that child has "extra" DNA.  Or, a child may be born with a "deletion" of part of the 18th chromosome;  that child is "missing" DNA.  Since Lane is missing part of the p arm of the 18th chromosome, he has a diagnosis of 18p deletion syndrome.

Regardless of the diagnosis, most affected individuals are cognitively challenged, and they often have difficulties with speech and also with gross and fine motor coordination.  Other common findings are growth hormone deficiency, heart defects, thyroid disorders, and difficulties with social interactions with their peers.

 

How Can You Help?

My wife, Becky, and I have volunteered to host a 2013 Chromosome 18 Family Conference in Savannah, GA.  It is scheduled for July 28th - 31st.  We hope that this time together will be a great benefit to those children affected by a Chromosome 18 diagnosis, as well as their families.  We have a full schedule of experts that have volunteered their time to help with education at our conference.  Talks are scheduled to be given by an ear/nose/throat physician, a pediatric behavioral physician, a speech therapist, a physical therapist, an occupational therapist, a pediatric play therapist, two lawyers who specialize in special needs planning, a certified special needs financial planner, and a genetic counselor.  Also, the staff from The Chromosome 18 Research Society will be on hand, to continue the research that has benefited so many in our extended Chromosome 18 Family.  The Chromosome 18 Registry and Research Society is a non-profit organization, based at the University of Texas at San Antonio.  Blood work and further developmental screens are scheduled for many of those affected who will be attending.  It is SO important that this research continues, and having many of those affected in the same city will be very helpful. 

So far we have between 400 and 500 people who hope to be in Savannah this July.  We're estimating the cost of the conference will be close to $40,000.  In addition to covering research costs at the conference, we will have additional child supervision provided by Corporate Kids, which has certified personnel trained to assist those who are medically fragile or have special needs.  We also hope to provide as many meals for attendees as is possible.  We have reached out to some local sources to assist with funding, and have also applied for special needs grants from several national businesses.  However, we have no idea how successful those options will be.  What we do know is that the importance of our cause is far-reaching, and the power of giving in America and all around the world is humbling!  Please help us make this conference a success for our Chromosome 18 kids and their families.  We think $5,000 through indiegogo is a realistic goal to reach, with the help of our new friends and supporters who have read our story here.  Please also remember that all contributions are tax deductible. 

Thank you for sharing!

Steve, Becky, and Lane

story:
Short Summary

In July, 2011 Strong Mind-Strong Body, Inc. ‘s inception took place at the University of Maine with a mission to offer an elite sports program for families lacking the financial stability to send their children to the costly summer sports camps. Prior to the program’s birth, Program Director and former football player at the University, Roosevelt Boone served as a basketball, football, and hockey camp counselor for the University of Maine. Boone became familiar with many local youth and their families through his volunteer work with the Black Bear Mentor Program and teaching field experience in the Kinesiology and Physical Education Program. These experiences allowed Boone to infer that 1) the prevalence of obese and low-income youth in central ME was just as severe, if not worse than the Washington, D.C. metropolitan area where he was raised; and 2) These at risk and obese youth miss the opportunity to experience the more elite summer programs do to their parents/guardians inability to afford them, and in return will result to at-risk behaviors during the summer months where idle time is more common.

As a former student athlete, it is Boone’s belief that for youth to become successful adults, they must see successful people on a regular basis, which is rarely the case in the lower socioeconomic neighborhoods SM-SB, Inc. targets participants. For this reason, we focus on employing student athletes, as they are competent in physical activity, disciplined students, motivated ambassadors of their hometowns and universties, and lastly every child's role model!

What We Need & What You Get

    The running of a diverse, multifaceted program is extensive and requires significant cost in order to ensure that we achieve our program mission and allow participants to get maximum benefits from our programs. The total amount needed to fund our summer initiative for 2014 is forecasted at  $20, 268.80 (based on two consecutive 10-day programs totaling $10,134.40 each). The breakdown of which is detailed below.

    Service

    Expenses

    12 Fulltime Staff

    $4,500.00

    Facility

    $750.00

    Program T-shirts

    $500.00

    Fitness Consultants (Yoga, Zumba, Nutrition, Outdoor Adventure)

    $450.00

     Liability Insurance

    $750

    Transportation

    $1,834.40

    Lodging

    $1,375.00

    $10,134.40 or $135.13 per child (based on 75 participants)

    We understand that for all potential sponsors, times are substantially difficult given the current economic climate. It is for this reason that we aim to foster situation where all stakeholders benefit mutually. The benefits of sponsoring a program like this are endless but include:

        (1) Advertisement for your Company, Foundation or Organization   (2)   Participation in a Local/National Initiative and brand recognition    (3)  Contribution to economic and social development for all of society (4)   Publication in all various forms of media associated with the Program.

    In keeping with our ethos of inclusivity and community, Strong Mind-Strong Body, Inc. has created a sponsorship platform, which has something for every person and business, at every level in society. Sponsorship levels range from Bronze to Platinum and can be found in the "perks" section.  All donations are tax deductible!

    The Impact

SM-SB, Inc. offers all of our services free of charge to youth ages 10-17 coming from households that meet the low-income guidelines set by DHHS. Over the past three summers, SM-SB, Inc. has served over 250 youth from Washington, D.C. and Orono, Maine, and employed nearly 20 University of Maine students on very limited funding. About 80% of all participnats reported involvement in extracurricular activies during the fall season, improved school attendance, and all express interest in attending college. 

Without sponsorship from supporters like you, this elite program would struggle to carryout our mission of improving the quality of life for families, neighborhoods, and communities, which we feel will result in a stronger, more physically fit America!

By sponsoring a participant for a little as $135.13, the Strong Mind-Strong Body, Inc. Wellness and Nutrition Summer Program can educate a child coming from a financially deprived home on the benefits of healthy/active lifestyles, competitive team sport participation, positive decision-making and academic success. All very important to the advancement of the United States, as we are the most obese Nation in the world!

Thank you for taking the time to review SM-SB, Inc.’s proposal. I hope you find our mission worthy of your investment!

-Roosevelt Boone

story:
Charlie Ryan... The Real Superhero.

 

Charlie and his family are from Norwich, UK, but have been living in Perth Austrailia for the last 5 years... it was supposed to be for a better way of life however their story is very different..

Charlie was first diagnosed with stage 4 neuroblastoma on 31.12.10. After 19 months of treatment which included 6 rounds of chemo, a major operation to remove his tumours, 2 rounds of mega chemo, 20 rounds of radiation and 6 months of intense immunotherapy. After all of this, Charlie was given the all clear in July 2012.

Sadly on only his second check up, 7 months after finishing treatment doctors discovered Charlie's cancer has returned. As yet there is no cure. Charlie has a very unknown future. His parents, my friends, Sam and Tony have a very limited time to decided what to do. If they do not opt for any treatment they have approximately 3 - 6 months left with him. If they try some of the trials on offer they might be able to buy him some time 6-12months. But this could also make him very sick for the time we have left with him. Its just the worst situation a parent could ever be in.

We all desperately want to get Charlie back to the UK for a visit with family and friends before he gets too sick. We also want to look at trials oversees. Unfortunately nothing has been proven to cure relapsed neuroblastoma YET..

Donations will go towards the families flights home and potentially towards clinical trials if they go down that route - which could cost around £300,000 in Germany for example... we will keep you posted.  Donations of any size are gratefully received, every last penny will help bring Charlie home to enjoy what precious time he has left and for us to enjoy him. 

This is a family in desperate need of kindness and support, praying for any glimmer of hope in this heartbreaking situation they find themselves in. 
Help me restore faith that good things do happen to good people and take away one thing, the only thing that,  I can actually control.
 
Please help me raise funds to bring Charlie home so they can receive the support and love that they desperately need.


Thank you for taking the time to read this page & thank you for supporting this cause.  Its great to witness the power of human nature at it's very best.

 

http://www.facebook.com/pages/Charlie-our-Superhero/133810383463068?ref=ts&fref=ts

http://www.facebook.com/thecharlieryanukfund?re...
story_txt:
Charlie Ryan... The Real Superhero.
 
Charlie and his family are from Norwich, UK, but have been living in Perth Austrailia for the last 5 years... it was supposed to be for a better way of life however their story is very different.. Charlie was first diagnosed with stage 4 neuroblastoma on 31.12.10. After 19 months of treatment which included 6 rounds of chemo, a major operation to remove his tumours, 2 rounds of mega chemo, 20 rounds of radiation and 6 months of intense immunotherapy. After all of this, Charlie was given the all clear in July 2012.  Sadly on only his second check up, 7 months after finishing treatment doctors discovered Charlie's cancer has returned. As yet there is no cure. Charlie has a very unknown future. His parents, my friends, Sam and Tony have a very limited time to decided what to do. If they do not opt for any treatment they have approximately 3 - 6 months left with him. If they try some of the trials on offer they might be able to buy him some time 6-12months. But this could also make him very sick for the time we have left with him. Its just the worst situation a parent could ever be in.  We all desperately want to get Charlie back to the UK for a visit with family and friends before he gets too sick. We also want to look at trials oversees. Unfortunately nothing has been proven to cure relapsed neuroblastoma YET.. Donations will go towards the families flights home and potentially towards clinical trials if they go down that route - which could cost around £300,000 in Germany for example... we will keep you posted.  Donations of any size are gratefully received, every last penny will help bring Charlie home to enjoy what precious time he has left and for us to enjoy him.  
This is a family in desperate need of kindness and support, praying for any glimmer of hope in this heartbreaking situation they find themselves in. 
Help me restore faith that good things do happen to good people and take away one thing, the only thing that,  I can actually control.
 
Please help me raise funds to bring Charlie home so they can receive the support and love that they desperately need.

Thank you for taking the time to read this page & thank you for supporting this cause.  Its great to witness the power of human nature at it's very best.
 
http://www.facebook.com/pages/Charlie-our-Superhero/133810383463068?ref=ts&fref=ts
http://www.facebook.com/thecharlieryanukfund?re...

story:
Hello,

     My name is Adam Hynes, and I am trying to raise enough money for my good friend Richard Vanwormer to pay for a surgery he DESPERATELY needs. 

     Richard was a surgical assistant in Dallas, Tx in 1997.  One night after his shift in the operating room, he stopped at a convenience store where he was randomly robbed and shot in the chest at point blank range.  He did not have health insurance at the time, and still does not.  The bullet is resting on a crucial nerve, causing him constant severe pain.  He also developed neuropathy as a results of the bullet.  See a description of neuropathy here- http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmedhealth/PMH0001784/ .  Over the years since the shooting, the neuropathy has consistantly gotten worse and worse.  He was no longer well enough to work around 2004.  At this point he is almost constantly in extreme pain.  His neuropathy causes his skin to feel like it's on fire on his face and back.  He has extreme nerve pain in his chest near the bullet.  He has extreme pain in his back and neck from muscles that are constanly tense and full of knots.  He is nearing the end of his ability to sustain such a nightmare of a life.  He is bedridden almost all the time.  Getting up to get food, drink, or use the bathroom is difficult enough that he is becoming malnurished and dehydrated.  The photo included with this campaign was taken about a year and a half ago, and he is noticeably thinner now.  Going to his monthly doctor visit is an enormous challenge, and leaves him in extra pain for days.  He has suicidal thoughts as a result of everything he has to endure.

     Richard lives in a 1973 RV, but will run out of money for rent within 2 or 3 months.  Government employees are in the process of trying to get him into an assisted living center, and also trying to get him on medicaid, even though he was denied social security disability and medicaid already.  Should he recieve any help from medicaid, or any other source, I will update this campaign to reflect the situation as it stands.  He is currently trying to recieve financial help from medicaid, and "texas Crime Victims fund".  We are also trying to convince our local hospital, Poudre Valley Hospital, to help him with the surgery he needs.   Richard currently recieves only $375 per month in help from all available sources.  We believe it is a real tragedy of justice that he has been denied any kind of medical help from the system that he paid into all the years working before he was no longer able to.  Richard has always impressed his friends with the discipline, tenacity, and drive he has shown in his efforts to help himself.

     As complicated a situation as it is, it really comes down to a simple point.  Richard MUST have the bullet removed from his chest if there is any chance he will live a life worth living.  If he does not have this surgery, I am very worried we will lose him to suicide.  He is already on the very edge of his ability to continue this way.

     We predict that the costs involved in having the surgery and recovering from it to be around $150,000.  There is a very lengthly recovery time involved in a surgery like this.  To remove the bullet, they must cut through nerve tissue.  They say it takes 2 to 5 years for your nerves to heal, assuming they do heal.  This campaign has one simple goal, to get the surgery.  As the campaign moves forward, we will be updating it to reflect numbers more accurate to what Richard needs.  Most likely the amount needed for the surgery will be different than our predicted cost.  The amount needed may be significantly more, or significantly less then $150,000.  If we accidentally raise more money than is needed, I promise to donate ALL of this extra money to a fund meant to help people with their medical bills, surgeries, or medical research.  Where the money is spent will be made public information, along with proof of where it goes.  Richard hopes to use this money to pay for a surgey, and allow him the ability to recover from it as well.  He will not be able to work during his recovery, so he will need very basic living expenses to be covered(rent, food, utilities, doctor visits).  The recovery period may last years, but we will know more once he can afford to see a doctor about the surgery and ask questions like how long the recovery will be.  This campaign will be handled as transparantly as possible, out of respect for those who wish to help Richard.  NONE of the funds raised by this campaign will be used in any other way.

PLEASE HELP!  Very sincerely, Adam Hynes

story:
Hey everyone, Cassie here. In late June a good friend, Tyler,  got seriously hurt by getting jumped by seven people. Not much is known about what happened. He is still in the hospitol in Reno,NV. Please help support him in any way. Show you care though contributions, sharing the campaign, give awareness of the people involved and more. 

I really want to see tyler awake and talking again and i know everyone feels the same. If all you can give is your stories with Tyler please share. Every good story, thought, memory counts....everything counts.

 

             ~Tyler we miss you~ Get well soon~

story:
short sumary

hello i am willy zogo i live in bangkok thailand i am studying her also playing basketball and acting in movies.

my young cute 3 years old boy is dying for a cancer now.it s been now 2 weeks that we have been in many hospitals out and in bangkok and many doctors rejected the case of my son saying the cancer is too big and they dont want to take a risk one of the best hospital in bangkok for kids case just sent us to another hospital out of the city after the ct scanner on the picture above shows that his cancer is too big and not even inside the kidney but close to the kidney since we are in this hospital the new one my son situation is getting worse 4 days ago he was talking and playing with me but now he cant even walk and here we just have to wait coz of many pple also his cancer went from 10cc to 13 cc today

What We Need & What You Get

i need a financial support to take my son to the best hospital of the country bumrungrad international hospital in sukhumvit road the problem there is the money becoz its too expensive few people in thailand can afford to go there i am sending this sos and expecting to see some people reatc please it is too hard for me to see my young boy dying and am just watching this is so hard.

The Impact

My son cancer it s not only killing him but its killing everything arround me ruining my life helping my son is giving him a second chance to live he s a lovely boy full of joy many people think its done but i dont think so i ll try my best untill he stop to breathe does he deserves that no i dont think so he is so lovely it will be so unfair for him to die now while his parents still alive please dont let it happen

Other Ways You Can Help

If anyone can help in another way please do not hesitate if someone know personally a doctor or a special medecines i need a huge miracle also i ll be thanksfull to you when u ll put my lil cute boy name tiger in your prayers may god help him thank you very much

story:
Guys Like Me

 

Who am I?

My name is Jackson, or Jacks for short. I’m a 23 year old transman or female-to-male transgender individual. As an adolescent, I wanted so badly to look like the buff shirtless men I saw on television and in advertisements. I hated myself for not having the body that I wanted, for instead having a body and chest that didn’t even feel like mine. As I grew older, I learned to accept that this was the body I was given and it’s the only one I’m going to get. So no matter what, I’m going to try to make the best of it in any way I can.

 

My transition

It’s hard to look in the mirror and not recognize the body that you see. It’s mind-numbing and demoralizing. Thankfully we live in modern times and there are options available for guys like me. I started testosterone treatments 6 months ago and the changes have been fantastic. Little by little each day, I move closer to my ideal. I can’t describe how wonderful it is to see myself becoming the man I have longed to be. But each day, I feel my chest, knowing that my body is still wrong in a rush of sadness, alienation, and anxiety. So I bind my chest flat daily and suffer the unfortunate side effects like blisters, sweat rashes, and a variety of other hazardous health effects from binding my chest flat.

My family, while being the wonderfully supportive folks that they are, do not support my decision to get surgery or any kind of medical intervention involving my gender, so I am financially on my own. I would not be able to afford the hormone treatments if it wasn’t for the care of the Mazzoni Center, an LGBT clinic in Philadelphia that provides low-cost or no-cost services to poor transmen like myself. I have also been in therapy for some time and can provide the required letter of recommendation, saying that “transgender surgery is the next step in the transition process”, a qualification also provided by the Trans Standards of Care (WPATH).

For me, top surgery represents the biggest happiness I can imagine, starting from when I was a young child. After years of research, advice, and self-reflection, I’ve made the final decision to pursue top surgery. At the end of the procedure, I will have a sculpted male chest. But the most valuable part of the surgery is that I will finally feel at home in my own body. All I want is to be happy and this is the key to it. And I will be the happiest bare-chested boy you’ve ever seen.

 

So I am humbly asking for your help and support to make this possible, to make my dream a reality.

 

I need your help!

Top surgery is very expensive, especially for a recently graduated young man attempting to make his way in the world. I’m in a professional training program for my dream profession right now, but the pay is dismal and most of it goes to pay for rent, bills, and food, so that I can survive. In this situation, it’s very difficult to find the money to put away for something that will help me thrive.

 

So this is where you kind folks come in. Here’s the breakdown of surgery costs.

Doctor’s fees: approximately $5,000

Surgery center anesthesia fee: $1300

Additional costs (transportation, blood tests, other hospital fees): $600-$1000

 

This seems like an insurmountable cost, but no amount is to small or too great. Every donation is a little piece of joy, a smile just for you, knowing I am one step closer to my dream, my one hope, becoming a reality.

Even if you can’t personally contribute, pass the word along. Signal boost. Send this to your friends and neighbors and allies. Because this surgery will literally change my life. For the first time, I will be able to feel my body and not feel dysphoria and pain; there will only be joy, happiness, and possibility. And that truly is the greatest gift of all.

 

EDIT (2/4/13): When I initially set this up, the perks did not save for some reason. I've fixed that and the perks are now up. For those of you who've already donated and would like to claim your perk, feel free to send a pesonal email to me (jacks.a.katz@gmail.com). Also, if there is something on this list you don't see but think I can do for you, let me know. Thanks all!

story:
My Story

I am an artist (and college student) who just had one of the most painful days in my life (physically and monetarily). I broke a side of my tooth weeks ago while eating and had absolutely no side effects until today. The pain came so sudden my jaw started shaking and I nearly passed out on the street. After going to see a dentist he filled my tooth temporarily but explained I need a root canal and crown (a $5000 dental procedure). I have no insurance and no one in my family to ask for this amount of money (my mother cannot help me we need a roof to sleep under and food to eat and my grandmother is in the hospital).


The Impact

I do not want your paycheck I get one every 2 weeks but I don't make enough money to afford this procedure so soon though. If my tooth gets further infected I could be hospitalized or I could get lockjaw which could kill me. Your help will prolong my existence longer.


What I Need & What You Get

What I need is $5000 because I do not have insurance. $2000 goes to a root canal and $2000 goes to a crown and $1000 goes to filling in the tooth and fixing the remainder of my tooth. I do not expect that big of a donation but anything helps. I have school loans to pay off but if I do not reach my goal I will have to obtain a third party financing plan with plenty of interest. I do not have any credit so I will not be able to obtain this easily either. Any contribution will help me avoid adding money to my loans. 

If you indeed can help me out I've decided to put my artistic talents to use as a thank you if you donate any of these amounts:

- $15 to $24 - you will receive a hand-made original watercolor thank you card.

- $25 and above- you will receive a one of a kind 11"x14" watercolor painting + thank you card.

- $50 and above - you will receive a one of a kind 16"x20" watercolor painting + thank you card.

- $100 and above - you will receive a one of a kind 22"x30" watercolor painting + thank you card.

- above $250 - you will get all three one of a kind artworks and a thank you card.

All works will be made by me after donations are received so that I can keep any cost of supplies to a minimum and most of the supplies I already have so none of my donation money will be going to them, just to my teeth.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand financial situations (since I am having my own as I explain this). Even if you can't help me financially your voice helps too. If you know anyone that could help save my mouth with even a dollar or two please spread my plea. I thank you all for your time, (money) and voice.

story:
What happened? 

As you may have seen in the news, there has been a devastating flood in the Atacama Desert (Chile) due to the heavy rain.  The river(s) completely overflowed, filled with strong currents destroying houses, cars, streets, etc. Chile needs your help, the people need your help. 

What We Need 

People have lost everything they owned, the strong waters have taken everything destroying from their kitchen appliances to their clothes, school supplies, beds, etc. Your money will go 100% directed towards the needs of these people. 

Unfortunately, we don't have any type of prizes for donors. We do believe in good karma, and we wish you the best . Thank you for the support, even if it's just sharing!  

The Impact

Your money will go towards:

-Food & water

-Personal care items (diapers, women's items, toothbrushes, toothpaste, etc)

Of course, this depends on the amount raised. If we reach the goal (or go above), we can help families buy house items such as mattresses and kitchen items. 

Help us make a change

We believe we can make big changes for the people in these communities with a little bit of help. Depending on the amount raised, we will be reaching more and more people.

story:
Welcome Friends!

thank you for clicking into my world! my name is lindsey phoenix...of phoenix rising wellness.

a little about me... i am mother to a wonderful 13 year old boy; my greatest teacher and challenger! our little family also includes our 14 year old cat "bugaboo" and 4 year old husky/shepherd "sadie".

for 12 years i have been working with so many awesome and wonderful kiddos with different abilities in a great variety of capacities; schools, their homes, my home, in the community, etc. i have loved every minute of it...even, and sometimes especially, the many challenges! now i am looking at expanding upon my substantial skill set so i can support these dear little ones from another angle. enter the bodytalk whole healthcare system...

if you haven't heard of bodytalk then you are in for a treat! if you have...great! you already know the vast, even limitless possibilities for support and health.

for those of you new to this world...

bodytalk is an integrative, consciousness based holistic healthcare system based on the philosophy that the body has an innate wisdom to know what is wrong and is capable of healing itself at all levels. sometimes this ability is compromised due to communication break downs within the body-mind complex leading to disease. one of the core philosophies of the bodytalk system is that all disease found in the body is reflected in the brain at some level. what the bodytalk system provides then, is the right conditions for reestablishing communication. the practitioner, as the observer, acts somewhat like a translator collecting information regarding these breakdowns then, through the bodytalk protocol facilitates a restoration of communication between parts of the brain as well as between the brain and all other body systems. Improving this communication can quickly and easily address many physical issues, as well as improve brain function overall.

Practitioners the world over are seeing amazing results working with children!!  i can't wait to begin contributing my unique gifts to this paradigm shift! some of the main improvements we see with children sometimes immediately and especially over time are:

  • stress reduction
  • long term improvements in how the brain responds to stress
  • improvements upon memory, learning, reading, attention
  • performance in school which can improve self esteem
  • strengthened immune system
  • improved emotional wellbeing
if i have piqued your curiosity and you would like further information i encourage you to visit the international bodytalk association (iba) website at:
https://www.bodytalksystem.com 


i have experienced first hand, from 3 years of receiving sessions regularly, how this system can shift and create wellness into the deepest aspects of our selves!!

i took my first bodytalk courses 6 years ago; since then i have also taken the mindscape course and bodytalk access (both through iba). i have also received my certificate in acupressure.

So Here's My Vision...
are you still with me?! feeling excited about the wonderful possibilities for wellness i will be co-creating within the wonderful world of bodytalk?!

yes you say?? that's wonderful because i am too!!

through the years i have developed a philosophy and belief, from my personal relationships with many wonderful children, that they are teachers, tapped into the higher realms, here to remind us who we really are...we are joy light love. it's really that simple! these kids are calling us back to our soul selves...to our innocence. i believe when we are seen as we truly are it is like a homing beacon. we never forget that feeling and we can more easily find our way back!
now, with bodytalk primarily, my vision is to help these little ones by supporting them into their alignment; seeing them through a lens of wholeness rather than their so called "pathology".
i am so thrilled and honored that the timing is ripe. i am ready and capable to expand my tools and share them with these special kiddos, adults and their families!

Love To Have You Along For The Ride! (How You Can Support)
so...onto the practicalities of making this dream a reality...
i am on my way to fulfilling the requirements to certify as a bodytalk practitioner within the next 4-6 months. this is a reasonable yet lofty goal and i am committed and excited to get going!!

step 1:  becoming certified and getting my practice started:

  • 2 part exam; $270 plus $60 processing fee,
  • purchase and complete the advanced procedures DVD course  $85,
  • upgrade to a practitioner membership with the association $165,
  • purchase a massage table $250.

step 2: The iba strives to provide the latest information in the field of energy medicine; continuing education is one of the hallmarks of being a certified practitioner. there are 7 more courses for me to take within the core bodytalk system alone! these are the next 2 courses i feel are best to build upon my foundation:

  • Principles of Consciousness: vancouver, december 5-7 cost: $800. for information on this course please visit:
https://www.bodytalksystem.com/seminars/courses/description.cfm?id=15

  • Breakthrough 1 and practical, victoria, march 27-30 2015. cost: $1000.

this course will offer support primarily for adult clients; rounding out my practice! again, for further information...

https://www.bodytalksystem.com/seminars/courses/description.cfm?id=28

ANY and ALL $ money donated will go directly to the cost of certifying, tools for my practice, and paying for these next 2 courses. the money you donate will help me begin dedicating all of my time to supporting children and their families much sooner than without your help! for now i will provide a mobile service for flexibility and ease of access. it will also keep my overhead low by not needing to rent a space or have liability insurance for it.

Stretch Goals
...should i be so fortunate, this is my focus for the next steps:
these 4 bodytalk courses: biodynamics, macrocosmic bodymind, matrix dynamics, bodytalk for animals.
...and then there are the 2 parama courses(also iba); a whole other universe that delves much deeper into the brain! i see this course taking me 8 months to a year to complete! our brains are that complex! 

i realize that i have given you so much information! because i am asking for your financial donation my aim is to provide a full picture of what i am about and the journey i am dedicated to undertaking; what you'd be supporting me in achieving. please do contact me with any questions, comments or concerns you may have before passing my campaign up! i would be more than happy to connect with you! i so appreciate anything you are inspired to invest in my dream! i promise you it will be a very worthwhile investment!

Some Perks For Your Support!
i am offering bodytalk access and full sessions starting at the $25 donation level. because of my mindscape training i am able to offer distance sessions...some people feel they are even more powerful than in person!

Other Ways You Can Help!
i realize not everyone can donate $ but you can help me spread the word! do you think your friends might be able to support me, or do you know a great community organization that might be willing to donate and/or spread the word? tell your friends on facebook...use the indiegogo share tools and spread my project on social media for all 60 days of the campaign! thank you thank you!!
story_txt:

a little about me... i am mother to a wonderful 13 year old boy; my greatest teacher and challenger! our little family also includes our 14 year old cat "bugaboo" and 4 year old husky/shepherd "sadie". 
for 12 years i have been working with so many awesome and wonderful kiddos with different abilities in a great variety of capacities; schools, their homes, my home, in the community, etc. i have loved every minute of it...even, and sometimes especially, the many challenges! now i am looking at expanding upon my substantial skill set so i can support these dear little ones from another angle. enter the bodytalk whole healthcare system...

story:
We are an integrative health care clinic which has served the Mission for 20 years and we have just lost our lease. We serve a diverse community of clients who share our commitment to a caring, holistic approach to health and deep community roots. We have remained dedicated to our ethics believing that great health care should be affordable to all.

We have helped the people in the Mission, and throughout SF, with their health issues. We have helped them resolve chronic pain, heal from injuries, accidents, trauma, resolve digestive issues, kept the working population healthy, get pregnant, have babies, and helped those with cancer during and after treatment.

We need to move to a new space that is affordable and we also need to afford the expenses of this transition. We were not planning on losing our lease, as the landlord had given us our new rent structure, so we were not expecting such costs (build-out) at this time.

We very much want to continue to be able to serve everyone including the underinsured. We do not want to raise our rates just so we can afford to pay off the incurred expenses we foresee. We very much want to remain a comprehensive, integrative clinic of and for the people. Can you please help us with this goal?  We need $19,750 to make this possible!

Established in 1996, The Lotus Center is an integrative medicine healing collective of practitioners of acupuncture, naturopathy, and therapy. Each of our providers carries a wealth of experience in both women's and men's health and our specialties include, but are not limited to: infertility, pain related conditions, digestive disorders, internal medicine, allergies and more.

Even if you can't help with a financial contribution, we'd love your help getting the word out about this project. You can use the Indiegogo share tool or share directly with the link to this site!

We are deeply grateful for your consideration...

story:
In 2015, FiSH conducted a survey (at the request of the council) that proves there is demand for use of the sports centre on Sundays (71% of ISL users surveyed were supportive) as well as proving financial viability of a trial. Council have voted down the proposal of a 12 month trial of Sunday openings (for 3 hours) claiming it is not feasible for financial reasons. FiSH members are not satisfied with this and will now proceed to raise the necessary funds, similar to other groups that partially funded the successful ISL early morning opening hours trial.

FiSH will continue to highlight the need for indoor sports facility access over the full weekend for the sake of our children's health as well as the health and well being of those who live in Lewis and Harris.

Please join our facebook group and the 1400+ families that are campaigning for 7 day access to indoor sports facilities! The survey and plenty of other information is available there or, feel free to get in touch and we can provide further information. 

Please note: Should we raise our goal amount within 60 days and there is a change in circumstances/financial need, all who have contributed will have a say in putting this money towards a charitable cause supporting children's health in the Western Isles. *Your pledges will not be taken until the goal amount has been reached as this is an "all or nothing" campaign.
