WHY WE ARE CREATING QHUAS With all the health and fitness programs, the medical alternatives, and the plastic surgeons, why is the count of obesity higher than it has ever been? What is missing? Today's health and fitness trends are based on identifying someone with the "ideal body" and working hard to make that your reality.  These programs are designed to make you wish for the body you don't have with promises that if you just follow their program you can look like the person on your screen or in the brochure.   
As a physical therapist, Sean has seen many people who have injured themselves on the path to this "ideal body".  Many have goals to become a certain weight no matter the cost.  Some suffer from serious depression once they realize that they may never obtain the "ideal body”.  At Qhuas we are working towards designing a lifestyle that will teach you to focus on being healthy, physically fit, and spiritually uplifted.  It will be a nurturing environment you’ll want to come back to.
 

  Other Ways You Can Help We understand if you can not contribute at this time, but that doesn't mean you can't help Qhuas get the funding it needs to go forward: 
Please go out and spread the word to everyone you know so that Qhuas can get the funding that it needs to focus on all of the elements that are necessary for the success of this program.
We welcome any media and press contacts that would like to reach out to us; We love talking about the amazing things we are doing with this program so contact us today. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools so that other supporters can find our project easily! 
 "Thank you for all of your love and support. Qhuas will be a positive way of life that is needed in today's society and we are so blessed that you are a part of Qhuas. Together we will make a difference. We love you!"                   - The Qhuas Family

story:
Everyone Deserves Quality of Life

In 2009, I was a passenger in a automobile accident. I was unconscious, the car was on fire, and I was pinned against the seat and the dashboard.  The top of the ball socket of my right leg was sheared off and my femur fractured. My left arm was broken in three places and my shoulder blade fractured. I had torn ligaments and muscles in my arm, leg, knees and ankles. I had over ten different surgeries to repair the damage but never gave up.

At the time of the accident, I was in the process of getting a Personal Training Certification. Doctors told me my career as a personal trainer was over since the injuries I sustained would hinder my ability to exercise. I was told I would have problems walking properly and I was confined to a wheelchair for 8 months. 

Determined to heal my body and overcome the odds, I created my own intense rehab program after one session of traditional therapy, knowing that I would be more dedicated and care more than anyone about my recovery. I was able to regain flexibility in my body, develop and repair muscle tone, and increase my strength endurance. I was not only able to walk again properly, but able to perform most exercises with the same intensity as before the accident. I committed to changing my life, and I live that change everyday understanding that the right attitude can make all the difference in achieving goals. 

I continued to pursue my passion of personally helping train people to change their lives. In 2011, a chance meeting with someone at a fundraiser would later impact my life again. Less than a year later, that acquaintance would call with an urgent request. A devastating accident had left her active and healthy son paralyzed with a Spinal Cord Injury sustained after a broken neck. Haven been given a dismal prognosis myself after my accident, I knew all that was possible and felt I could help him have a better quality of life. Not having all the equipment needed to help stimulate his dormant nerves and muscles for this type injury was a huge disadvantage to what we know we can achieve.

With state of the art, functional electrical stimulation equipment and an activity based exercise program, those with Spinal Cord Injuries, stroke victims, accident victims with limited strength, those with MS and Parkinson's can improve their health, avoid hospital confinements and make progress in having a better quality of living.

Having my accident taught me how to understand what those who are injured are going through. To sympathize with the mental strength needed to fight for your health. This equipment will enable me to utilize all that is available out there to help people on their journey to recovery.

Functional Electrical Stimulation (FES) is a well established rehabilitation technique which uses pulses of electrical current to stimulate peripheral nerves evoking muscle contractions and patterned muscle activity.

With Restorative Therapies' systems, FES creates patterned movement in the arms, legs and trunk. FES enables muscles to work and perform activities even though the muscles may be weak or paralyzed through neurological disease or injury. An FES bike, or Functional Electrical Stimulation bike, is a device that applies measured charges of electricity to paralyzed muscles. This enables the muscles to improve or even restore their function.   

What We Need

Three main pieces of FES equipment needed will cost $163,809.00. Additional equipment Like the NeuroGym Sit to Stand, the Vibration Plate, All in One Total Gym, Parallel Bars, Adaptive gloves, wedges, mats, occupational therapy manipulatives and other adaptive pieces will be necessary to convert my existing gym to a neurorecovery facility and will cost approximately $50,000. I want to be able to offer scholarship funding to individuals who desperately need the rehabilitation and cannot afford the therapy and will use $35,000 to fund initial scholarships.

Making A Difference!

In the United States, the average inpatient stay for a person with a Spinal Cord Injury is 29 days. The average age of spinal cord injuries is 16-30 years old. Young people just starting their careers, families, with their lives in front of them. Most are sent to nursing facilities with no hope of recovery if family members are not able to care for them around the clock. Most will never recover to the point they can live independently without therapy. There are approximately 1.2 million people living with spinal cord injuries (SCI) in the United States and in the US, every 48 seconds, a person becomes paralyzed. These are staggering statistics. Without hope of therapy opportunities, these individuals have little quality of life. Help me offer the best therapy options available to those with disabilities in the Tampa Bay area. Nothing like this in our area exists for the hundreds of Spinal Cord Injured and others with neurological disorders. YOU can make a difference!

My existing studio is already up and running and I am seeing clients with disabilities. . My near fatal experience and poor prognosis for recovery gave me the wisdom to overcome all obstacles and know that the impossible is a state of mind. My prior work with clients with true disabilities of substantial degrees has given me the confidence to move forward with my goals knowing that I CAN help them overcome their injuries and physical limitations.

You may not be able to donate financially. There are other ways you can help us meet our goals! You can help us SHARE our campaign with friends, co-workers, family and others who want to help others. Don't forget about the awesome Indiegogo share tools you can use to spread the word fast!

story:
Family Is Family!

Remember that most orphans are orphans for life. They have special needs. A family that will always love them and that will be with them for life is one of them. 

"Help SXS Sorority Make Good Magic For Orphans!"

House of XI Maidens! SXS Sisters of XI Sorority Orphans!
http://www.houseofxi.com/hxi/sorority/sorority_orphans.htm

Diamonds In The Rough!

Sisters of XI Sorority Orphan Resource will be seeking out orphan candidates to sponsor through college level studies and career preparation. The areas of SXS Sorority sponsored studies can include endeavors such as Rhythmic Gymnastics, Dance, Tennis, Volley Ball, Graphic Arts, Swimming, Marine Studies, Geological Studies, Agriculture, Archery, Fencing, Cheer Dance. Audio Video Production, and even Fashion Design - We've been an accredited employer at F.I.D.M. Fashion Institute of Design and Merchandising for many years. For Example, students enrolled at FIDM can receive school study credits for working on SXS Sisters of XI Sorority "Vie de Elegance! (TM)" Fashion Projects.

Love Is Good, Yet It Is Best When It Is Shared!

For starters we need initial funds to properly setup a lasting trust that will make certain that the resources actually get where they are supposed to go. SXS Sorority has friends and contacts living in regions and cities into which we send assistance, cutting through the red tape of politics and self serving religious organizations, 

The cities which we have chosen to send help to, indefinitely, are Sophia Bulgaria, Belfast Northern Ireland, Dublin Ireland, Prague Czech Republic, and Bucharest Romania. 

SXS Sorority is committed to freeing forgotten and abandoned children from the constrains of poverty and social status, by giving them the education and international association to know, without a doubt, that they do count and that they are able to live the life they had hoped for. They will receive support through college and beyond. 

The Impact - More Means More!

What must be understood is this... It is very difficult for a ten year old student to strive with confidence, when they expect to be expelled and later abandoned to the world, once they've reached a certain age, anyway. 

Support from the SXS Orphan Resource gives that same ten year old the hope and surety that their efforts will count and that their accumulated skills, education and experiences are meaningful. A family for life, no matter what, supercharges and inspires that Kid to believe in them self, learn more, and be better prepared for a productive and more expressive life. 

Risks & Challenges

Our campaign financial goal is very small to help insure that at least the first step (organizing a 501c3 Trust) gets accomplished. Then we will need your help to raise much more and start sponsoring some Kid's educations and career preparatory activities for them! Let's Do This! 

Help Us Be Able To Tell Another Abandoned Child That People Care About Them So Much That Their Education Is Funded!

And That They Have A New Family!

For Life!

SXS Sisters of XI Sorority - We Really Can Change The World - One Life At A Time!

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't just wait for us or someone else to help these Kids. Get on the web, get on the phone, and find orphans or orphan care givers and ask them what they need. You can probably help more than you think that you can.

Here are just a few things the SXS Sisters of XI Sorority found that orphans really need Right Now! 

Clothing, grooming supplies, school supplies, medical care, school uniforms, rail passes to get to school, books, art supplies, technical supplies, computers, eye glasses, documentations - they are expensive and a constant set back for orphans at every stage of life, hearing aids, wash towels, food, and nutritional supplements - these Kids deserve vitamins too. 

Just contact an orphanage and see for yourself how much is needed and what you can do about that, You Can Do It!

Jordon is my cousin and is currently fighting cancer at the minute, so I would like to raise some money for her so that she doesn't need to worry about her living expenses. 

Any donation small or large will make a big difference :) 

Thank you in advance Charley, Jordon and all the family xox

story:
SHE-BEAST - noun- A gentle, driven, in your face monster with a heart of gold who never gives up. Aggressive, assertive, unwilling to fail. MaryJane is a She-Beast!

She beast is a name given to my mother by her friends who witnessed her overcoming health problems to help her lead a more active and healthy life. My mother has never failed to impress me with each new venture she undertakes and her day-to-day determination to get through. A year ago on January 12, 2013 after a year of training, she walked a half-marathon (13.1 miles). This may not seem like a big deal until you understand that my mom is 54 years old, 260+ pounds, 4'10" and suffers from the following ailments: moderately severe rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, fibromyalgia, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, hypothyroidism, high blood pressure, insulin resistance, degenerative lumbar spinal stenosis, and lupus.

It's been downhill in so many ways since she did the half marathon. The toll to her body was very costly. Being nearly sedentary makes losing even more difficult, though she maintains a fairly healthy diet and monitors everything she eats. She's been counseled by three different doctors that bariatric surgery may be the best option for her, and without it her life expectancy is very short. Nothing else seems to work. She visited one of the top bariatric surgeons in San Antonio. He told her she was one of the best candidates for this surgery, that she NEEDS this surgery. We have health insurance through my step-dad's employer. They do not cover any type of weight loss surgery, even though it means she will have less doctor visits, less health problems, less medication and less injuries if she gets this weight off, saving them thousands of dollars every year. She's spoken to several of the insurance company's patient advocates.  This company has NEVER changed their mind about weight loss surgery, even with the doctors' letters of medical necessity. Even the bariatric surgery center tells her that the insurance provider we have (one of the biggest in the world) never okays weight loss surgery. We keep hitting dead ends. The surgery is out of reach for us financially, since she is a full time, unpaid caregiver and they live off of my step-dad's income.

What We Need & What You Get

Our ultimate goal is $15,000 to pay for the surgery and associated costs. We are planning to undertake some local fundraising ventures here in San Antonio but $15,000 is a lot of money to make! I'm certain, however, that with as much love as we have in our hearts for my mom, we will succeed.

We are working on developing some "perks" but the ultimate perk is the knowledge that you helped save a woman's life. Also, if you donate a pretty significant amount, I'm sure we'll come up with something special!


Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE SHARE SHARE! The only way this campaign will be successful is if YOU help us out and share this page with your friends, coworkers, and families!

LINKS: FACEBOOK PAGE - "Like" us at: https://www.facebook.com/SaveTheSheBeast

Articles published on MaryJane and her plight: http://www.examiner.com/article/san-antonio-woman-s-plight-to-beat-battle-of-the-bulge

Video interview with MaryJane: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Gs_X4mKAVJI

Associated Press article and pics: http://www.seattlepi.com/news/medical/article/Health-plans-don-t-cover-weight-loss-surgery-5234763.php#photo-5882561

Buy a Save The She Beast t-shirt: https://www.booster.com/save-the-she-beast

story:
About the Project

Yoga is a transformational art designed to bring our mind, body and spirit back into balance. It helps us to appreciate who we are and love the skin that we are in. In popular media only one type of yoga body is highlighted and there is little representation for fuller bodied women. Because of this, many women don’t think they have the “yoga body” and hesitate exploring yoga, even though it has countless benefits.

This book serves as a testament that yoga is for EVERYbody and that no one physical size is better suited for practice. It will celebrate beautiful goddesses of all curvy shapes and sizes and finally allow the beauty of our curves to be recognized in this blessed art called yoga.

The true essence of yoga is what you do from your heart, not what you do with your body.

Finishing the Project

We've gotten so much support on the project and there are a few things that need to be done before we an officially launch the book.  We hope to raise $10,000 to get the book completed and distributed to the masses!  Donations will go towards:

  • Finalizing the book layout 
  • Final editing
  • Marketing
  • Printing

We Appreciate Your Support

With your support we will be able to spread the message that yoga is for EVERYbody!  We believe that everyone can benefit from practicing yoga and know that the book will inspire practitioners of all sizes to explore yoga.

If you are unable to contribute financially we ask that you send your support by spreading the word to your family, friends, social networks or by thinking of us the next time you spend a quiet moment of reflection.

Thank you for your support!

story:
Med3D is currently in the top student teams in the second round of Duke start-up challenge. This campaign is set up to raise funds to support the team's developments through the summer part of the competition.


                              


Annual imaging for breast cancer screening

The American Cancer Society recommends annual mammograms for women starting at the age of 40. To ensure that all women have access to quality mammography for the detection of breast cancer in its earliest, most treatable stages the mammography quality standards act (MQSA) became law in 1992 and the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) enforces its accreditation and certification.


Quality assurance of the imaging systems

Quality assurance testing of mammography systems is currently performed on a daily or weekly basis and according to manufacturer's recommendations using uniform slabs of tissue-equivalent plastics with necessary test structures embedded in them known as "phantoms" in the field.

Recently, a quasi-3D form of mammography known as tomosynthesis has also entered clinical use, which provides three-dimensional information of the breast and suppresses tissue overlap. There is currently no proper quality assurance testing devised for tomosynthesis units and committees of manufacturers and regulatory organizations as well as researchers in the field are commissioned with tackling this problem worldwide.


What's missing

The uniform phantoms are far from representing a realistic breast background, hence significantly underestimating the sophistication of actual detection tasks. Currently, there is no anthropomorphic 3D physical breast phantom available commercially. The need for an anthropomorphic and anatomically relevant phantom with three-dimensional structure is even more pronounced in the case of tomosynthesis quality assurance testing.

We hope to change this!

In addition to regular quality assurance testing, physical breast phantoms are essential for the development, optimization, and clinical evaluation of new and emerging patient-specific 3D x-ray breast imaging systems. These phantoms are used for various tests such as system characterization, reconstruction evaluation, cross-platform comparisons, and dosimetry to name a few. They should ideally be capable of serving as the ground truth for purposes such as virtual clinical trials, which are less costly and time consuming than clinical trials and eliminate the irradiation of the population.


Our solution

Our physical breast phantoms are generated from the extended cardiac-torso (XCAT) virtual breast phantoms, which were segmented from human subject dedicated breast computed tomography data. High-resolution multi-material 3D printing technology is used to fabricate the physical breast phantoms. Multiple prototype variations are fabricated and tested.

            

The mammographic projections and tomosynthesis reconstructed images of the fabricated phantoms show great improvement over available phantoms, presenting a more realistic breast background. 

                       

Our prototype physical breast phantoms have raised a huge interest in the community. They have been introduced at several international technical conferences, and are constantly being examined by regulatory organizations in the US and Europe.


Why we need your help

In order to further improve upon our phantoms, we need to develop custom materials that will better represent the x-ray attenuation properties of tissue. We also envision creating customizable libraries of phantoms with breast size and density variations, tumors and microcalcifications, and potentially contrast agent absorption. We need capital to make these happen and advance our prototypes to clinical and research application. With your help we can a get jump start, fund our developments through the summer, create necessary partnerships, and advance our market analysis.

Who we are

We are a team of engineering students at Duke University. Our team has advanced to the second round of Duke Startup Challenge among the top student teams. Our team works with advisers in engineering, science, medicine, and business.


Got a question? Leave a comment!

Please contact us via email at Med3DSolutions@gmail.com with your questions and comments. Thank you for your support and interest.
story_txt:
Med3D is currently in the top student teams in the second round of Duke start-up challenge. This campaign is set up to raise funds to support the team's developments through the summer part of the competition. 
                               

 Annual imaging for breast cancer screeningThe American
Cancer Society recommends annual mammograms for women starting at the age of
40. To ensure that all women have access to quality mammography
for the detection of breast cancer in its earliest, most treatable stages the mammography quality standards act
(MQSA) became law in 1992 and the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) enforces
its accreditation and certification.
Quality assurance of the imaging systems
Quality assurance
testing of mammography systems is currently performed on a daily or weekly basis and according to manufacturer's recommendations using uniform slabs of
tissue-equivalent plastics with necessary test structures embedded in them known as "phantoms" in the field. Recently, a quasi-3D form of
mammography known as tomosynthesis has also entered clinical use, which
provides three-dimensional information of the breast and suppresses tissue
overlap. There is currently no proper quality assurance testing devised for tomosynthesis units and committees of manufacturers and
regulatory organizations as well as researchers in the field are commissioned
with tackling this problem worldwide.

What's missingThe uniform phantoms are far from representing a realistic breast background, hence
significantly underestimating the sophistication of actual detection tasks. Currently,
there is no anthropomorphic 3D physical breast phantom available commercially. The need for an anthropomorphic and anatomically relevant phantom with
three-dimensional structure is even more pronounced in the case of
tomosynthesis quality assurance testing. 
We hope to change this!

In addition to regular quality assurance testing, physical
breast phantoms are essential for the development, optimization, and clinical
evaluation of new and emerging patient-specific 3D x-ray breast imaging
systems. These phantoms are used for various tests such as system
characterization, reconstruction evaluation, cross-platform comparisons, and
dosimetry to name a few. They should ideally be capable of serving as the ground
truth for purposes such as virtual clinical trials, which are less costly and
time consuming than clinical trials and eliminate the irradiation of the
population.

Our solutionOur physical
breast phantoms are generated from the extended cardiac-torso (XCAT) virtual breast
phantoms, which were segmented from human subject dedicated breast computed
tomography data. High-resolution multi-material 3D printing technology is used
to fabricate the physical breast phantoms. Multiple prototype variations are
fabricated and tested.              
The mammographic projections and tomosynthesis
reconstructed images of the fabricated phantoms show great improvement over
available phantoms, presenting a more realistic breast background.                         Our prototype
physical breast phantoms have raised a huge interest in the community. They
have been introduced at several international technical conferences, and are
constantly being examined by regulatory organizations in the US and Europe. 
Why we need your help

In order to further
improve upon our phantoms, we need to develop custom materials that will better represent the x-ray attenuation properties
of tissue.
We also envision creating customizable libraries of phantoms with breast size and density variations, tumors and microcalcifications, and potentially contrast agent absorption. We need capital to make these happen and advance our prototypes to clinical and research application. With your help we can a get jump start, fund our developments through the summer, create necessary partnerships, and advance our market analysis. 
Who we areWe are a team of engineering students at Duke University. Our team has advanced to the second round of Duke Startup Challenge among the top student teams. Our team works with advisers in engineering, science, medicine, and business. 
Got a question? Leave a comment!Please contact us via email at Med3DSolutions@gmail.com with your questions and comments. Thank you for your support and interest.

story:
Anithos Greek Organic and Reserve Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil

Brought to you by Minghelli Imports

The Reason We Started Minghelli Imports and the Anithos Brand

Minghelli Imports and the brand Anithos was formed with the idea of bringing the highest quality authentic Greek olive oil to the United States. This idea came from the reality that there is an incredible number of diluted and mixed olive oils on the market. Whether you are shopping in your local fine foods store, grocery store or enjoying a dish at your favorite restaurant, you will find olive oils that claim to be 100% olive oil but in reality are not.

                       

Nearly half of all olive oil sold in the United States is "cut" with vegetable oils. These deceptions can lead to flavorless, bland and unsafe olive oils. There have even been cases of severe allergic reactions caused by olive oils that contained flower, vegetable or nut oils. Along with these oils, brands are also “cutting” their olive oil with genetically modified canola, soy, cottonseed and corn oils. There are currently no genetically modified olives in production, so customers wishing to avoid those ingredients often look to olive oil as a healthy alternative but may end up unknowingly buying genetically modified products anyway.

 

These less than authentic oils are a pallet and health hazard. They are also being marketed to consumers as premium or even reserve olive oils for a premium and not so reserved price! These olive oils are also being touted as phytonutrient and anti-oxidant rich, heart healthy and cholesterol lowering. Such diluted olive oils may not have these healthy benefits.

Why We Need Anithos Olive Oil

As self-proclaimed foodies and lovers of olive oil, we have gone to so many stores and restaurants and have been underwhelmed by the olive oil we purchased or used. As Mediterranean people, we have had a love for olive oil inherited from thousands of years of cultivation and culture. Now as residents of Tucson, Arizona, we want to bring those traditions with us and better yet, help America experience them too!

As olive oil purists, we always look for authentic Greek olive oil from the regions we know have the best quality, the best production methods and some of the oldest orchards in the world. We were sorry to see that our local stores, and even the farmers markets carried very few if any, single harvest, organic, certified Greek olive oils. The reason for this is because much of Greece’s olive oil is sold to Italy and Spain to be diluted with other olive oils or vegetable oils and sold to the US after more processing and mixing.

With our brand Anithos, we seek to bring 100% single harvest, first cold pressed olive oil, from ancient Koroneiki olive groves, hand-picked by people who take great pride in their orchards and their production methods. The same people who only want to create the very best and who are excited to extend their skills to a market that truly cares about authentic olive oil.

 

Extra virgin olive oil should be eaten daily for optimal health according to many experts.

About the Olive Oil:Flavor, Certifications, Awards and Labs

 

Anithos organic extra virgin olive oil is certified by the USDA to be 100% organic. It is also certified by the European Union and the FDA. It has a much lower acidity level than blended olive oils which typically have a level of 1.5%. Anithos also has a much lower acidity level than most single olive varieties which typically have an acidity level around 0.8%.

Anithos organic extra virgin olive oil has an acidity of 0.35% and the organic reserve extra virgin olive oil has an acidity of less than 0.25%. These low levels of acidity create a unique and excellent flavor. In the international tasting competitions in Italy, olive oils from this orchard have come up as one of the top three organic extra virgin olive oils in the world.

 

The prized orchards that produce such pure and flavorful olives are located in southern Greece, in the prefecture or county of Messina in the Kalamata region and are made up of 100 acres with 2.000 olive trees. They have been deemed by the European Union as a‘Protected Designation of Origin’ or a PDO.

A PDO refers to olive oils with "exceptional properties and quality derived from their place of origin as well as from the way of their production.” The certification of PDO products enables the use of acknowledged special markings, which warranty full compliance with Community and National Legislation requirements. Source: OliveOil.eu - Expoaid.gr

How Do You Know You Have a Quality Olive Oil?

The key factors in dictating whether or not an olive oil is extra virgin are as follows:

·Olives should be pressed within 16 hours of being picked.

·Olive oil must have a free acidity level of .8 grams for every 100 grams or less.

·Olive oil must be produced only by mechanical means, no use of solvents or chemicals.

·During production, the oil must not exceed 86°F (30°C)

Other factors include:

·Knowing where the olive comes from

·If it is from multiple harvests or multiple types of olive

·If it has been mixed with any other kinds of olive oils or vegetable oils

·If it is organically grown and how it is harvested

Anithos Premium Reserve Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil

Each year, a special crop of olives are harvested for the Reserve Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil. Reserve olive oil is made from the finest estate Koroneiki olives using a single cold extraction process. It is unique among the premier olive oils of the world due to the microenvironment in which the olives are produced. The estate is located at an elevation of 400 meters, the trees are over 400 years old and the unique soils where these special trees thrive, receive only natural water. This special product of nature produces high polyphenol content in our olive oil. Polyphenols are powerful antioxidants and contain anti-inflammatory nutrients. The result is a source of health and well-being for both nutrition and longevity. In addition, the oil has an exquisite richness with a balanced fruit essence and a hint of wild green almond. The hint of almond flavor is a result of wild almond trees which grow on the estate.

 

Our Mission and Request

Our mission is to bring this great organic and organic reserve extra virgin olive oil from Greece to the US, at a reasonable price for superior quality and taste. We are seeking the assistance of the Indiegogo community to help us make our dream come true by funding $75k for the bottling, labor, import fees, value added tax, transportation, marketing and nationwide distribution of the first 10 tons of the current stock, to the US.

Ideally, we would love to raise enough funds to bring at least 20 tons of the olive oil at the cost of $150k. To bring the entire stock of 40 tons of organic and 10 tons of the organic reserve to the US, it would cost $314k. This includes all of the bottling, shipping, labor, import fees, value added tax, transportation, marketing and distribution, so any money above the $75k will be greatly appreciated!

Once the quantity of Anithos olive oil arrives in the US, the first phase and this Indiegogo project will be complete. We will then distribute the products using avenues such as Amazon.com and direct sales to restaurants and small business food stores. The next phase will include using the profits to fund next season’s harvest and shipping of the olive oil to the US. This year, we will be looking for companies in the US to bottle and label our olive oil.

Risks and challenges

As we all know, every project comes with unexpected delays or problems. We are, of course, hoping to avoid these things but in the event that we have a delay or set-back, we are fully prepared to use all of our available resources to remedy them.

Minghelli Imports has a strong team who will be using their social networks, their family resources and their experience in business and e-commerce to help this project succeed! We also have great connections with our team in Greece, who are prepared to help us in any way they can to bring this wonderful olive oil to the US! We are hoping for a smooth shipment process from Greece to the US and have taken all the necessary steps to insure that the olive oil is certified, FDA approved and ready to pass customs. We have also taken the steps to secure all necessary codes, labels and documents to be able to sell and distribute the olive oil right away.

The rewards for our backers will be delivered first upon a successful project. Then we will concentrate on Amazon.com and other retail areas! In the event of any delays or even if it is smooth sailing, we will keep our supporters in the loop at all times with Indiegogo, Facebook and web page updates!

Thank you very much for taking the time to read about our project!

story:
A Project with a meaningful Purpose

  • My name is Nathan Cron, and I am the founder and owner of MobiLab Express. For more than seven years, our company, Bayside Mobile Medical Service (dba MobiLab Express) has been providing in-home medical specimen collection service to all types of people and organizations.
  • More than 75% of medical diagnoses are made based on blood test results.
  • Yet, tens of thousands of individuals have difficulty accessing the medical diagnostic testing that is critical to managing health and diagnosing disease because they are immobile, home bound, or have limited mobility.
  • Unfortunately, traditional medical insurance, like Medicare or Medicaid, wont cover the cost of a service like this. So low income and fixed income individuals rarely have medical insurance coverage that will pay for our service. 
  • These individuals need a reasonable, cost effective way to access medical testing.
  • Cost effective: Cheaper than costly medical transport to a lab and less expensive than a visit by a concierge home visiting doctor or nurse.
  • Appropriate Use: We employ trained medical lab technicians to perform the work. Medical lab technicians are the most skilled at medical specimen collection, processing, and delivery. Therefore they are also the most appropriate type of medical personnel to perform in-home medical specimen collection services.
  • Your contribution could help us reach these individuals who have fallen through the cracks in our healthcare system. A $100 contribution helps us reach 1 home bound person to get the critical lab testing they need.

What We Need

  • We want to raise $20,000 establish a non-profit organization whose sole purpose is to find funding to provide specimen collection support service to those in need.
  • If we are successful in raising the funds to establish the non-profit, the initial goal of the non-profit is to raise $200,000 so we can reach at least 200 individuals a year!
  • But even if we don't reach our funding goal to start the non-profit, all funds will go toward the cost of providing in-home specimen collection support service for low-income home bound individuals in our community.

The Impact

  • A blood test helps doctors diagnose & treat disease.
  • A blood test can improve someone's quality of life. 
  • A simple blood test can save someone's life.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute, please just share our campaign with your friends and family.
  • Visit us online at www.MobiLabExpress.com or on FaceBook at: www.facebook.com/MobilabExpress

Thanks for your time, we really appreciate it!

story:
About Me

My name is Troy Jungjohann; I’m 45 years old and was diagnosed with Stage IV Colorectal cancer with metastasis to my liver in September of 2009.  I served in the United States Air Force from 1987-2000, where I picked up the nickname of Jungleman, and it has stuck with me ever since.  I currently work as a IT Systems Administrator at St. John’s Hospital in Springfield, IL. 

I’ve been married to my soul mate Valerie for the past 24 years and I have three of the most beautiful daughters a guy could ask for, both inside and out!  Elodie is 22 years old and will be completing her nursing degree in December.  Stefani is 17 years old and will be a senior in High School and is a member of the National Honor Society.  Emilie will be 14 in September and has a great sense of humor and I suspect will seek a performing arts major when college rolls around.  She loves the having spotlight on her!

I love to cook, but have not spent alot of time doing it lately because sometimes the smell of food nauseates me. Before being diagnosed, I loved playing volleyball and golf, but haven't been able to play either lately. I've taken up photography in the past 10 years and my favorite photos are of landscape and architecture and prefer night photography.

Why this campaign is important to me

The reason I'm putting this campaign together, is to help ensure my wonderful wife Valerie has a small savings account with enough money to bridge the gap between my salary no longer being there and life insurance being paid out.  This includes paying for funeral expenses and any unforeseen medical costs.  Sure, I have medical and life insurance, through my employer, which has been great.  But life insurance is something I never put much thought towards, until I was diagnosed.  At the age of 42 I really thought I’d live forever and have my health.  Who doesn’t at that age!

That horrible day in September 2009, everything came crashing down!  I was told to get my affairs in order because I only had 3-6 months.  I am still here after nearly three years!  I was referred to University of Texas, MD Anderson for a liver resection.  Several trips to the Houston Medical District produced a lot of travel and hotel expenses and two failed surgery attempts.  One because my liver was toxic from the chemotherapy and proceeding with the surgery would have caused liver failure and I would have passed away.  The second surgery was cancelled because the doctors found small spots in my lungs, meaning the cancer was spreading.  My team of Doctors and Nurses have been awesome and have kept me going so I can spend as much time with my family as possible. 

Two months ago, I was informed that I had exhausted all federally approved chemotherapy regimens.  I was referred to Jefferson City, MO for an Early Acceptance Program (Post Phase three clinical trial, waiting on the FDA to approve) of the drug Regorefenib.  This has given my family and I Hope once again that we can win the waiting game and the medical community will find a cure.  

I have a lot of fight in me, but I’m non-operational, and therefore terminal.  Obtaining additional life insurance after a diagnosis such as this is impossible.  My wife and three daughters mean the world to me, and I hate to think of how life for them will be without me.  I hate to think they are going to have to grieve all alone, which is unthinkable because I’m usually the calming force. 

The VA claims I make too much money for any benefits.  While in the Air Force I made enough money to cover my expenses and bills, but at the end of the month we never seemed to have enough left over to put into a savings or additional life insurance.  That’s why I’m creating this Indiegogo campaign to humbly and graciously ask people for their donations. 

Receiving your donations will allow me opportunity to enjoy the remaining time I have with my family, by having the peace of mind to know that my family will have this nest egg.  The money raised here will definitely help financially, but the fact still remains, I won't be there to help them emotionally or mentally once I leave this earth. 

What We Need & What You Get

The funds collected bridge the gap between my salary stopping and life insurance kicking in.  The generously and graciously donated to my campaign will also be used for funeral arrangements.

Any donation at all will receive a shout out from me on my Facebook fan page (http://www.facebook.com/JunglemansFight).  I'm going to try to make them funny so everyone gets a good laugh.

The first 100 people to donate $100 or more will receive a Jungleman’s Fight silicone wrist band   

Any donation over $500 will receive a personalized Origami Owl living locket.  You tell us what your interests are and we'll put one together for you, and send it to you!

Other Ways You Can Help

Prayers and well wishes are always welcome.  We believe in the power of prayer!

Share this page with as many people as you possibly can, let’s get this campaign to every

The reason I'm putting this campaign together, is to help ensure my wonderful wife Valerie has a small savings account with enough money to bridge the gap between my salary no longer being there and life insurance being paid out.  This includes paying for funeral expenses and any unforeseen medical costs.  Sure, I have medical and life insurance, through my employer, which has been great.  But life insurance is something I never put much thought towards, until I was diagnosed.  At the age of 42 I really thought I’d live forever and have my health.  Who doesn’t at that age!
That horrible day in September 2009, everything came crashing down!  I was told to get my affairs in order because I only had 3-6 months.  I am still here after nearly three years!  I was referred to University of Texas, MD Anderson for a liver resection.  Several trips to the Houston Medical District produced a lot of travel and hotel expenses and two failed surgery attempts.  One because my liver was toxic from the chemotherapy and proceeding with the surgery would have caused liver failure and I would have passed away.  The second surgery was cancelled because the doctors found small spots in my lungs, meaning the cancer was spreading.  My team of Doctors and Nurses have been awesome and have kept me going so I can spend as much time with my family as possible. 
Two months ago, I was informed that I had exhausted all federally approved chemotherapy regimens.  I was referred to Jefferson City, MO for an Early Acceptance Program (Post Phase three clinical trial, waiting on the FDA to approve) of the drug Regorefenib.  This has given my family and I Hope once again that we can win the waiting game and the medical community will find a cure.  
I have a lot of fight in me, but I’m non-operational, and therefore terminal.  Obtaining additional life insurance after a diagnosis such as this is impossible.  My wife and three daughters mean the world to me, and I hate to think of how life for them will be without me.  I hate to think they are going to have to grieve all alone, which is unthinkable because I’m usually the calming force. 
The VA claims I make too much money for any benefits.  While in the Air Force I made enough money to cover my expenses and bills, but at the end of the month we never seemed to have enough left over to put into a savings or additional life insurance.  That’s why I’m creating this Indiegogo campaign to humbly and graciously ask people for their donations. 
Receiving your donations will allow me opportunity to enjoy the remaining time I have with my family, by having the peace of mind to know that my family will have this nest egg.  The money raised here will definitely help financially, but the fact still remains, I won't be there to help them emotionally or mentally once I leave this earth. 
What We Need & What You Get
The funds collected bridge the gap between my salary stopping and life insurance kicking in.  The generously and graciously donated to my campaign will also be used for funeral arrangements.
Any donation at all will receive a shout out from me on my Facebook fan page (http://www.facebook.com/JunglemansFight).  I'm going to try to make them funny so everyone gets a good laugh.
The first 100 people to donate $100 or more will receive a Jungleman’s Fight silicone wrist band   
Any donation over $500 will receive a personalized Origami Owl living locket.  You tell us what your interests are and we'll put one together for you, and send it to you!
Other Ways You Can Help
Prayers and well wishes are always welcome.  We believe in the power of prayer!
Share this page with as many people as you possibly can, let’s get this campaign to every

story:
Short Summary

What is a Wave Pool?

Wave Pools are build to provide fun waves for surfing for each experience level. These wave pools require energy to generate waves. That energy may be obtained from renewable sources: solar, wind, tidal, thermal and hydroelectric energy.

Why wave pools?

  • Surf spots do not have always the type of conditions you seek;
  • When the conditions are perfect the crowd may be annoying;
  • Flat periods can be annoying and ruin a training plan;
  • They allow surfers to test and learn new maneuvers; 
  • They are the surfing equivalent to half pipes (skate)  and snowboard slopes; 
  • They are safer than the ocean.



What you get if the 50k USD goal is NOT surpassed:

You become a shareholder of a start-up called SurfDream Inc - a Portuguese Wave Pool company. The money will be used to study a Wave Pool at Peniche and/or Cascais.


What you get if the 50k USD goal is surpassed:

A Wave pool project for everyone: disabled people, high performance center, average surfer, is going to be built.


Business model:
Goal: Make the learning curve for surfing easier by:
  1. Study natural waves and existing wave pools;
  2. Determine places where wave pools are welcomed by the local community;
  3. Determine the best shape and other macro pool parameters;
  4. Design the pool bottom bathymetry;
  5. Perform both numerical and laboratory tests;
  6. Fine tune the design;
  7. Get some sponsors to build the pool and operate it;
  8. Build  wave pools at those locations - e.g. Peniche / Cascais / Costa da Caparica;
  9. Set a ticket price that reflects the demand while assuring the access to less wealthy people. There will also be some monthly passes;
  10. Employ a life guard to ensure the users safety;
  11. Incorporate local rent of surfboards to use in the pool;
  12. Enjoy safe surfing  and keep the beaches clean.


Some case studies: 

  • Dubai Wave Pool
  • Wave Garden
  • Ericeira - Coxos, Craxy Left and Ribeira d'Ilhas 
  • Pipeline

Risks & Challenges

  • Ambitious project
  • Large Team
  • Defies the status quo
  • Amount asked may not be sufficient
  • Environmental concerns
  • Project expected to start 1st January 2015 and finish 1st January 2020

Other Ways You Can Help

Believe this idea and share it with your friends. 

Any question / suggestion send an e-mail to marujo.surfdream@gmail.com

Describe your campaign and why it's important to you:

“FitTheLand” is a unique application for your body, which will support and motivate you step by step, helping you to change and improve yourself. This stylish and user-friendly application will be your essential partner and assistant on the way to achieve your goals.

Application will help you make a suitable and well-balanced diet plan according to your objectives. “FitTheLand” will always remind you when to eat, as well as keep a watchful eye on what you eat!

Track your physical activity.

“FitTheLand” conveniently offers you various levels of training programs: Beginner, Amateur and Professional.

You can create workouts for various purposes (weight loss, muscle building and retention) and various places (home, outdoors or gym). Our library consists of a wide range of exercises for different muscle groups together with correct and complete information on how to perform them.

Application will mark your advancement and achievements with special rewards.

“FitTheLand” is both your personal trainer and dieting expert. Apart from personal recommendations this application will suggest the nearest gyms and sport nutrition stores, wherever you might be.


What contributors will help you achieve:

We don’t want to make just another fitness app.

Our goal is to make the application, which would be large-scale, truly engaging, motivating and giving people self-condidence!

We want to encourage everyone to live a healthy lifestyle and exercise regularly.

We are driven by our desire to develop what we care for.

This is a very important mission not just for us, but also for the whole sports community! People have to be strong, healthy, successful and look into the mirror with pride!

We are confident that this application will make the world a better place! That is why we put our hearts and souls into this work.


Story:

Sometimes I would start working out at the gym, and it seemed like once and for all.The first two such attempts were futile, because I didn’t know how to train and track my progress.But the third time I decided to tackle this matter from a different angle.I spent a few months studying nutrition science and body structure and only after that I went to the gym to achieve specific results.After some time I decided to keep track of my diet and exercise.For this purpose I started looking for a suitable application. I downloaded about a dozen applications and even paid for some of them, but every time I ended up with a pencil and paper calculating the results myself.And then an idea struck me: “what if”!I spent a couple of the following months developing this idea. As a result, in the beginning of 2013 I started writing down everything required for such a unique application and also found companions, who helped me create this project.


What We Need & What You Get:

Owing to your contribution to our idea we will be able to hire a professional mobile application development studio, which will put all of our ideas into life.

All donations will go to development, enhancement and initial support of the application.


Our goal is $151.500 and we understand that it’s quite a lot of money but that’s the price we have to pay in order to implement all the intended functions


Perks:

Сollector’s T-shirt

- The online store will be sold 15 unique design t-shirts with different themes (Cities "art style")

Collectible t-shirts that you get for your contribution have a limited series, will be released only once.

A special reward in the trophy room

- The application will present a section where everyone can receive awards for their achievements (For example, if you run 500 miles there will be new achievements in the trophy room)

- All contributors will be given a unique rewards 1 through level 7, depending on the deposit amount


Plan:


Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal:

In case we fail to achieve our target goal, we will work towards a gradual creation of the app one step at a time


Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world:

Currently you have to download many fitness applications, count calories, set timers, do exercise, search for recipes, etc.

The screen of your mobile device is filled with shortcuts.

You have to switch back and forth between applications, some of which you must pay for. All of these manipulations are very confusing and inconvenient.

We offer:









Risks:

We have conducted a thorough risk analysis and found out that the main risk is attributed to the choice of a mobile application development studio.

For this purpose we have spent much time searching for a professional mobile application development studio with large experience and the highest quality standards that has already been engaged in a global project.

story:
Our mission is to revive the study and practice of Traditional Islamic Healing & Medicine (TIHM), an ancient tradition rooted in the sacred that is slipping away.

We hope to raise $110,000 in this campaign to complete construction of the Hakim Wellness Health and Education Center, to serve as headquarters, clinic, and laboratory.


About Us

We are a 501c3 non-profit Islamic health and education center – established in 2000 – delivering customized treatment and education, regardless of ability to pay. We have facilitated the healing of suffering patients who had not found solutions elsewhere, and of too many who simply could not afford any treatment at all.

Ḥakīm Ilyās (Ilyās al-Kāshānī) is the founder and director of Hakim Wellness. He has been studying TIHM since he was six years old. More about Ḥakīm Ilyās.


Our Challenge and Need

TIHM is in danger of being lost and forgotten. Through our initiatives (education, treatment, and partnership) we are working to preserve, develop, teach, and practice TIHM. To support our mission, we need a facility that will serve as headquarters, clinic, and laboratory.

Treatment: A customized clinical space will allow us to provide the full range of  holistic health services we are qualified to deliver while also meeting the increasing demand.

Education: Given that true healing requires active patient participation, a comprehensive program of support that is built on education cannot be overemphasized. This facility will allow us to offer educational programs to our patients on-site and customized for their specific needs. We will also offer TIHM training program for students and professionals, to birth the next generation of healer-physicians.

Partnership: Supported by an online multimedia platform, we will form a global network of students, practitioners, scholars, and masters to preserve, study, develop, and share TIHM.

We must raise $110,000 to complete construction of our facility, which will include a clinic, herbal dispensary, and medicinal herb garden. We have funds for construction up to the halfway “framed” stage —temporarily protected from the environment but still unusable. If we meet our fundraising target of $110,000, construction can be completed by May 2015, insha’Llāh.


Who We Serve

We treat everyone from infants to the elderly for acute and chronic conditions, whether physical, mental, emotional, or spiritual, and regardless of ethnicity, sex, religion, or financial circumstances. We are frequently sought by people who are desperate, whether their doctors have nothing more to offer them or they have been advised to undergo an invasive, risky medical procedure and recognize the wisdom in exploring other options first. Given that holistic medicine looks “outside the box” —taking into consideration the entirety of possible influences in a person’s illness— we are especially skilled at supporting challenged patient populations, such as children with developmental issues. We have a track-record of successfully facilitating the healing of the vast majority of our patients using safe, elegant, and effective holistic therapies, thus saving them from continued suffering and costly medical expenses.


People First

The spirit of TIHM is centered on service, not profit. We have patients who pay for our services, and we treat patients who simply do not have the means (approximately half of our treatment hours are pro bono). There is no eligibility application to fill out or supporting documents to submit. No one is questioned about their circumstances. Everyone stands on their own integrity. And no one is turned away. Our all-volunteer staff and board are a testament to our service-centered mission.

In 2002, in response to a pressing need, we traveled to India where we offered pro bono treatment for children at the Happy Home and School for the Blind in Mumbai. Over the course of seven weeks, we treated disabled children —some autistic, some born blind, some blinded by medical mistakes or tragic acts of sectarian violence. This service effort was made possible by the contributions of our humble supporters. Now, your support will allow us to take our service to the next level.


What You Get

Touching the hearts of people in need is its own reward. We forget ourselves and remember what really matters in life. Your charity will endure as a transmission of healing to suffering patients, the training and empowerment of a new generation of TIHM healer-physicians, and transformative knowledge for the social and spiritual elevation of community.

Additionally, your donation is tax-deductible to the full extent of the law (processed by our 501c3 non-profit, the Circle of One). And, we are glad to offer a range of gifts for your generous contributions, including audio recordings of guided meditation sessions, private training sessions, comprehensive health evaluations, customized treatments, and personalized BodyMindSoul retreats in paradisal settings in the US and abroad.


Other Ways You Can Help

Any support you can offer is greatly appreciated, even simply spreading the word about our campaign (Indiegogo share tools, Facebook, Twitter). If you believe in our project, we humbly request that you make a personal appeal to trusted friends and family members on our behalf. We are grateful for your support. May Allah s.w.t. bless and reward you!

story:
Short Summary

   My name is Lauren and I am raising money to fund my mom, Dawn, in her cancer treatment. She has been battling cancer for four months and it is now aggressively attacking her liver.  We live in a part of the world with many amenities, yet it is still ethical to refuse life-saving treatment because of inability to pay up front. Our family has collectively exhausted our financial resources battling her cancer so we are turning to you for help. Without treatment she will be leaving behind her husband, parents, siblings, nieces, nephews, four children and granddaughter in a matter of weeks. This campaign is to pay for at least four additional rounds of treatment with the hopes that it will be the last needed.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

   We understand that times are tough and not everyone can donate. This doesn't mean you can't help!! In this case we ask that you tell three friends about our campaign and ask them to tell three of their friends and so forth. HELP US SPREAD THE WORD!!

story:
Hi – thanks for taking the time to read my story.  My name is Emory Moe, although most people simply call me Emo.  I’m a musician from San Diego, California.  I recently underwent open heart surgery to repair a valve in my heart.  The surgery was successful, and I’m very grateful to be alive, however my out-of-pocket expenses have been exorbitant.  This is compounded by the fact that I haven’t been able to perform since mid-December, and as a musician this means I have had no income whatsoever.  Simply put, when musicians don’t show up to play, they don’t get paid.  Going without any source of income is non-sustainable just for normal living expenses, but it’s the medical expenses that have prompted me to ask for your help.

 

I’ve had to go into debt to pay all these bills, but because I’m not a greedy person, and I’d always prefer to pay my own way in life, I’m only asking for about half of what my medical expenses are.  Whether I exceed my goal or don’t reach it, every penny raised will go towards those outstanding bills.  My surgery took place at the end of December, and my 8-day hospital stay extended into the first week of January.  What that means is that the deductible on my insurance had to be met twice, once for each year.  I’ve had to carry a very high deductible in an effort to make my premiums more affordable.  (“Affordable” and “Medical Insurance Premiums” are definitely conflicting terms!)  It’s been especially difficult not being able to earn any income this year.  In California, unemployment benefits and disability insurance are unavailable to the self-employed. 

 

Please check out the perks I’m offering, below.  My offering to the world is my music, and my offering to you as a contributor to my campaign is also my music.  My main gig is as the bass player and vocalist for the classic rock band; The Brokers Band.  (www.thebrokersband.com)  This is a bunch of guys who happen to be great musicians in addition to truly wonderful people.  Throughout my ordeal, including several months of being disabled, they have saved my position in the band.  We’re now making plans for my comeback as soon as I’m able, and we’re all very much looking forward to that day.  In addition to my commitment to The Brokers Band, I play classical guitar for quieter, mellower events.  (www.emotheguitarguy.homestead.com)

 

Besides having a good bunch of guys in my band, I also have some wonderful friends who are organizing a fundraiser for me.  This will be on June 1, 2013 at Larry’s Beach Club in Oceanside, California.  There is sure to be some great entertainment, a silent auction, raffles, etc.  I’m truly honored that among the performers will be Roni Lee, Mojo Nixon, Joey Harris and the Mentals, Samz Jam, Third Degree, and the Decades, in addition to The Brokers Band.  Comedian L.G. Brown is set to MC the event.  If you are able to attend, I will certainly be honored by your presence.

 

If you are able to contribute anything at all, I will be extremely grateful.  Every penny will relieve the mountain of debt I have accrued.  Whether you are able to contribute or not, please consider passing the word along to others using the share buttons below, sending email, word of mouth, or any means at your disposal.  Every effort will be fully appreciated.

 

Thank you so much for your time and effort on my behalf.  Please feel free to contact me with any questions at haveaheartforemo@gmail.com.  Bless you all!

Besides having a good bunch of guys in my band, I also have some wonderful friends who are organizing a fundraiser for me.  This will be on June 1, 2013 at Larry’s Beach Club in Oceanside, California.  There is sure to be some great entertainment, a silent auction, raffles, etc.  I’m truly honored that among the performers will be Roni Lee, Mojo Nixon, Joey Harris and the Mentals, Samz Jam, Third Degree, and the Decades, in addition to The Brokers Band.  Comedian L.G. Brown is set to MC the event.  If you are able to attend, I will certainly be honored by your presence.
 
If you are able to contribute anything at all, I will be extremely grateful.  Every penny will relieve the mountain of debt I have accrued.  Whether you are able to contribute or not, please consider passing the word along to others using the share buttons below, sending email, word of mouth, or any means at your disposal.  Every effort will be fully appreciated.
 
Thank you so much for your time and effort on my behalf.  Please feel free to contact me with any questions at haveaheartforemo@gmail.com.  Bless you all!

story:
EVENT DATE: FEB 08, 2014



THE STORY:

Hello everyone, My name is Mia.
You may not know me, or some of you may do, but i was hoping i can raise awareness that i am trying to compete at the National Archery tournament.

So, i am ever so happy i have come so far, went to my first tournament and actually qualified for NATIONALS! This has been such a big accomplishment for me!

So, i got in, now am i really able to go?

 I'm Dreaming BIG to reach out into society for a lending hand. Archery is my passion and i get to do some kind of extra curricular activity besides shoving my head in books all day. University is OP!

This will be a 3 day trip

Tournament Registration fee: $65
Archery Individual Membership Fee: $45
My uniform: $45
Transportation: $90
Hotel Fee: $220
Water, Food, MISC: averaged to about $50-100

Total: about $515

Thank YOU all for your love and support, I'm hoping for the best!
The Tournament is February 21st but i must be registered by FEBRUARY 8, 2014!
I would be so grateful and happy if this helped reached my goals!

story:
Aloha everyone.  We are Cliff and Jacqui Jordan.  Our good friend Karl (Karlos) Zartler has recently been diagnosed with a rare, advanced form of Well Differentiated Liposarcoma Cancer.  After extensive surgery to remove the sizeable growth from his shoulder area Karl will now undergo skin grafting, radiation, chemotherapy and extensive rehabilitation.  Karls fight has started.  His amazing wife Lynnette and son Nick are standing strong by his side taking care of him. 

Karl grew up in Newport Beach California and has been surfing has been his passion since age 5.  He is one of the top surf instructors in Maui and usually surfs everyday, teaching his love of catching the perfect wave to anyone who wants to learn and always making sure, they do ride a wave (hey, he helped me ride a wave or two and learn to paddle board)....  This sudden change in his life has been devastating to his mind, body and soul.  Watching our friend and his family go through this is heartbreaking.  We want to help..  In every way.... 

I am reaching out to family, friends and the local community to raise funds for the Zartler's medical and living expenses during these strenuous times,  anything you can donate would deeply appreciated. 

Please consider giving a donation to the "Zartler Family Fight Liposarcoma Fund"......

**Note:  Information to follow for donations to the "Zartler Family Fight Liposarcoma Fund" with Bank of Hawaii to follow...

story:
Nina's Story

  • Nina is a 23 year old wife and mother of 2 beautiful children. She was in a tragic car accident November 2011 which resulted in several life threatening injuries with the most devastating being paralysis. Nina is a parapalegic but she is NOT letting it define her! With the support of her family and friends, and most of her optimistic attitude towards her condition, she is not letting paralysis get the best of her!
  • With the increasing costs of basic medical needs as well as unique therapies not covered by insurance, funding is vital in Nina reaching her maximum potential and most importantly, maximum independence! As her current therapies are being evaluated, Nina feels as if she is "reaching her ceiling." As awareness regarding paralysis increases, as does endless upcoming physical therapy treatments. Nina's wish is to attend an intensive "boot camp" like therapy for 23 weeks! Non-stop training, therapy and most of all, HOPE!
  • Financial assistance from contributors will change Nina's life! Without additional funding, Nina will not be able to participate in these invasive therapy programs. More and more are offered, however, the cost is rising quickly! Every program attended, increases Nina's chance of maximizing her potential and reaching her long term goal--Walking!  

Reaching Our Goal and How We'll Get There!

  • If we don't reach our goal, we will continue to fundraise in any way possible! All funds raised will be utilized for the same goal--Helping Nina gain mobility and independence! We are starting the process of becoming a legal Non-Profit 501(c)3 organization! We will keep you posted about our Non-Profit!
  • Other fundraisers included our first Beef & Beer in Fall 2012. Our next Beef & Beer is scheduled for June 2013! Check out our FaceBook page for more details: https://www.facebook.com/FriendsAndFamilyForNina

The Programs

We are PLEASED to announce that Nina has been formally accepted into The Miami Project!! Upon completion of intense testings and screenings, Nina will be going down to Miami to participate in this well-known program for 23 weeks!

  • The Miami Project: www.miamiproject.miami.edu
    • Located in Miami, FL
    • Managed by University of Miami, Miller School of Medicine
    • Costs include housing, transportation
    • Length of Program is 23 Weeks
    • Invasive "boot camp" like program
    • 4-5 Hours of intense therapy per day
  • Project Walk: www.projectwalk.org
    • Located in Atlanta, GA
    • Costs include therapy @ $115/Hour, transportation and housing
    • Length of Therapy is based on Funds Available
    • Intense activity based program that focuses on education, training and research & development

Help Us Spread Awareness and Change Nina's Life!

  • Please share our page and help us spread awareness about paralysis!
  • Help us change Nina's life!

 

Read More About Nina's Story...

https://www.facebook.com/FriendsAndFamilyForNina

http://www.youtube.com/user/FriendsFamily4Nina

story:
Discover 8 project

 

Discover eight is composed of young individuals who have a deep interest in helping people regain and maintain their health. After learning about ways to remain healthy without the use of medication or Doctors, a burning desire was now left in our hearts to help others discover what we have learned. As was expressed in the video above, people are dying more and more as time progresses which can be stopped by following a simple lifestyle plan; the eight laws of health. Individually and collectively, we are determined to make a difference in communities around the USA. So we came up with a plan to devote ourselves for a period of 3 months helping individuals, educating them on how to live a healthier life on their own. To buy an RV traveling along the East Coast, making stops at churches, homes, businesses, schools giving seminars, lectures and offering our services to the public.

 

The list below shows just an estimate of the items in which the funding will be going towards. Our $50,000 goal as proposed is just the minimum fundings.

 

·         -Rv - $35,000-40,000

·         -Food - $3,000

·         -Insurance- $2,000

·         -Equipment - $1,500

·         -Gas - $5,000

·         -Miscellaneous-$ 1,000

·         Total:$52,500

 

This project will make a Huge difference in communities around the US. We believe many lives will be changed and even saved. Its not about anyone of us, its about people out there seeking for help; teaching them, consulting with them, giving them educational material on a healthy lifestyle, showing how to prepare meals, and a lot more. But most importantly showing them to cure their diseases which will not only add years to their life but life to their years. Your contributions will help us reach those people in need, those people who are diseased and needs treatment.

If you are unable to contribute to this project but want to help in this cause, feel free to share our video to your friends and family. It will be a great help by just getting the word out to people telling them about this project we want to undergo in helping people lives. We will like to thank everyone who supported us financially or any other way in helping us make this project possible. Thank you!

Vist us Discovereight.com

story:
I’m Karla and I’m from Denmark. I’m on an important mission to show the world what Nordic Food is all about so that everyone can make it at home.

Within the last couple of years, The restaurant NOMA in Copenhagen has three times been awarded the best restaurant in the world serving only Nordic food, but few people know how to cook Nordic food in their own homes. We are sure that most people sometimes want to eat something healthy for dinner, but have too little time to prepare it at home, buy the groceries and so on.

If you are anything like we are, there is just not enough time during a busy week for cooking a decent and healthy meal for you and your family. But if you did in fact have the time, we are sure you would like to do it, and that you would feel sooo much better if it was a healthy and delicious meal that you could even share with your friends and family.

Everybody should have a chance to enjoy life a bit more and stop stressing about cooking at home. We are here to introduce the world to the easy and healthy ways of Nordic home cooking with a new exiting Nordic Internet platform called Karla’s Nordic Kitchen.

Please help us show the world that we are here, so that we can all eat better food every day and have fun while doing it.

Project Information:

In august of 2011, Karla won the National Danish championship of Home Cooking. Shortly afterwards she went online with her Danish food blog called www.juliekarla.dk. Now, Karla has been writing about Nordic food for almost three years, and collected a lot of knowledge about the Nordic Kitchen and the best local recipes. She is ready to share this knowledge with the world on an international food and recipe website, so everyone can try it out at their homes.

We’re seeking 1500 dollars to launch the website internationally, which will give us a chance to introduce the whole world to a healthier way of life while eating delicious Nordic food. We have spend all our money making most of the website functional, but people need to know it’s out there, and we need to make it welcoming for all the visitors for it to really work.

The 1500 dollars we are seeking will be spend directly on a campaign for the website. Our goal is to have 100.000 monthly visitors before New Years Eve 2014.

The website is called www.karlasnordickitchen.com and has been under construction for some time now and we are almost ready to launch it internationally and we really need all the financial helping hands we can find to let the world know it is out there. We want everybody to have a chance to eat healthier food and find out why The Nordic Kitchen has become so popular.

Why the Nordic Kitchen? The best restaurant in the world is called Noma and serves only Nordic food based on Nordic Ingredients. The Nordic countries are in fact packed with Michelin restaurants and some of the best chefs in the world are the Nordic chefs. Generally and all the Nordic countries are doing a great job at serving some of the most nutritious food in the world. It’s low carb, high protein, organic, and loaded with vitamins. Most people are not familiar with the Nordic kitchen and have no chance of cooking all these amazing and simple dishes at home, and we wanna do something about that.

The Nordic Kitchen may seem very innovative, but the overall philosophy is actually to use ancient ways of cooking dating back to the times of the Vikings, to make simple and very tasty food that everyone can make. And it’s based on organic and very healthy ingredients such as lamb, salmon, game and fresh berries.

The Karla’s Nordic Kitchen campaign will promote the site all over the Internet and we will upload as many Nordic recipes as we possible can.

Our ambition is to create a solid platform of permanent readers and fans; so that once the site is launched it will stay online and will become and remain a great place for all to come and visit online. We will do our best to get the information out there for all to find. We will fight for healthy organic foods made from the best ingredients we can find, and we will make Karla’s Nordic Kitchen the talk of the town.

We will give people a chance to sign up for the recipes, to share our recipes with their friends, and we will fill the site with all the best pieces of dining and eating advice we can find for everyone visiting.

We will continuously strive to include every reader we can find in the cooking adventure, and we will try to make a website, which is accessible for all.

We want our visitors to the website to leave:

• Knowing more about the Nordic Kitchen • being able to apply the recipes in their own home cooking • being ready try out the best Nordic food when visiting any of the Nordic countries

We have several goals for the campaign:

• Introduce the world to the Nordic Kitchen • Reaching a 100.000 monthly impressions within 5 months • Helping people cook more healthy food in their busy lives that leaves them with too little time to try cooking at home • Create a free printable Nordic cooking calendar available for free download at the site.

We need $1,500 to build and launch the campaign.

The Website & Launch Budget is:

$200: creating a free Printable calendar and download option coding. $800: Search engine optimization. $200: Domain and server administration. $100: Hosting. $200: Facebook advertisements. $100: Enhance website design for traffic

__________________________________ Total: $1,500

Your support will help us begin our journey and provide everyone with a chance to try Nordic food in their own homes.

Thank you, Julie Karla

story:
NOTICE: T-Shirts and Mini Marker Discs have arrived and will be shipped out shortly. If you did not have a chance to pick it up at the event or in person, you should receive your perk within the next 3 weeks.

How you can help...

Basket Cases disc golf club was founded in 2013. Since then we have been an active part of the disc golf community, including making park improvements, hosting events, and growing the sport from a grass roots level.


On May 3rd and 4th, 2014 Joe Duncan and Garry Murphy will be making a Guinness World Record attempt for the most disc golf holes played in 24 hours. Breaking the current record will be fun and extremely challenging. With this event they hope to increase the awareness of disc golf in the community. We are asking for donations which will equally benefit both our club and Coloma Township Park District.


Our general goal as a club is to increase awareness of the sport of disc golf, to improve the park conditions, and encourage new disc golf courses to be designed and installed in more public parks. We believe in putting all the funds we generate right back into the sport. We ask that you help support not only our club’s initiatives, but also the Coloma Township and their parks program.


Note: You will be contacted about T-Shirt size after May 5th if you choose a T-Shirt perk.


What it means...


  • 50% of everything raised will go to the Coloma Township Parks Department, 50% will go to club initiatives of public park improvement.
  • Example of club initiatives are park improvements and basket replacements at Sergeant Means Park in Olympia Fields, IL and other parks. 
  • Immediate funding for park improvements and safety concerns in both locations. 
  • Supporting our club mission to grow and expand awareness of Disc Golf
  • Help park districts and have fun while doing it
  • Bring new players to the sport


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get involved in your community and volunteer
  • Support local clubs and organizations
  • Ask about park cleanup days or other park events near you
  • Be heard at township meetings and board meetings for your community
  • Share with your friends using the links below!
